text: This was truly a major disappointment.  The restaurant is way over-priced and the food is just "average".  There are so many of these types of restaurants around that I would not waste my time with this place.  I had a steak and shrimp dish that was average.  Shrimp was OK but the steak was tough and over cooked.  I ask for medium rare and got medium which was well done by the time everything else was cooked.  Service was marginal yet the restaurant was not full.  Very disappointed and would not recommend this to anyone.

Poor service. Waited too long for our food. Sent it back because it was poorly prepared - was worse second time.  Forgotten meals. Talked to the manager and he said "sorry" and scurried away. I worked many positions at a local restaurant and am more forgiving than most - this was unacceptable.

I went here with my family for a special occasion. I was so excited because I had been wanting to try this place for a while. The waiter was very nice and the chef at the hibachi was really funny and my niece loved his sense of humor (she is 3).  I ordered a drink called city peach which is peach vodka, pineapple juice and orange juice- very very sticky ingredients. The bar waitress who brought the drink, spilled it all over my leg and the floor. I was very cold, very wet, very very sticky and very very uncomfortable the entire meal. My shoes kept sticking to the floor which no one bothered to wipe up. No manager ever came over to apologize or comp my drink which really upset me. I paid full price for 1/2 a drink essentially which I stressed my dissatisfaction over and still no manager came over!  The shrimp was good and so was the steamed rice, but the veggies were very bland tasting, I ordered steak, cooked medium, it was well done which made it hard to chew and dry...thank goodness for "pink sauce" to cover it up!!  I was very upset over the drink and meal - for all 6 of us it cost over $200 - NOT worth the money. I do not mind spending money for a meal but only when it is a GOOD meal worth the money - AND, I had to rush to my mother's house which is nearby for a rest room since I got sick off something.  This place is not worth your time or money!
Lunch: Filet mignon and shrimp was delish! Ginger salad dressing and shrimp sauce was awesome!

After my previous experience at Nakama the General Manager stepped up an showed outstanding customer service!  Im happy to say i will continue to eat at Nakama thanks to the upper management,  & for my love of the food, but im still upset i cant have my food exactly the way i want it.

We've been here a few times. I think it used to be more of a scene a few years ago, but I still think the food is good. It's the same hibachi show you'll get at any of the local places. I'm vegetarian, and some of the chefs really know how to be nice to a vegetarian (cook your food first, before there's meat on the grill), but not all of them. You'll get better service if you go when they're not busy.

Our party of 7 went in for hibachi on a Friday night. We made reservations and only had to wait a couple of minutes for the table to be ready. Three of us were vegetarians and the waitress was nice enough to let us know that the soup had a meat based broth. Our chef was great and even prepared our vegetarian food before putting the meat on the grill. Overall great and delicious experience!

I went there with people from work and it was a lot of fun.  We sat at one of the Hibachi's and ate some really good food.    The sushi was also really good and I normally am not a sushi person.  I would recommend for a fun evening.

I have been to Nakama for many happy hours in my earlier professional days.  Recently, I arrived for sushi with my friend Katie around 7:30 PM on a Thursday (great downtime to get a seat at the bar following their popular happy hour).  This was an impromptu outing after assisting Katie with some logistics for this year's Silk Screen Gala & Film Festival.  We started with beverages and placed an order of edamame.  They definitely place a good amount of sea salt on those green soy goodies, which I LOVE.  Thursday is ladies night, which allows 1/2 off of a selection of mixed drinks, beers and/or house wines.  Together, we surveyed the area, making up fun and comical stories about our fellow bar patrons.  #Goodtimes  Next, we placed our order for sushi (the main entr√©e), cleansing our palates each with  a salad.  I had the Nakama salad with their yummy ginger dressing.  Katie had a spectacular cucumber salad, mixed with soy sauce, sesame seeds and red pepper bites.  Finally, the sushi arrived in its artistic and flawless state.  Fresh and colorful, we each chose 2 types (totaling 4): Asparagus Tempura, Spicy Tuna Roll, Baked Alaskan (our favorite), and a Hawaiian roll. Nakama has a moderate to high price point which makes sense, due to their prime location in Pittsburgh's South Side neighborhood and terrific ambiance.  I will definitely be going back.  Oh, and knowing that we ate so healthy (minus the salt and soy sauce) made for a non-bloated ride home.  #30somethingproblems  Review can be found on my website as well:  http://wp.me/p43vGR-YX

One of the more popular/trendy places to be, always busy (youll need a reservation for the habachi tables, and be prepared to wait to get a spot at the sushi bar). However, im not a sushi person, so I cant comment on that. The food here is certainly good, but I wouldnt go so far as to say spectacular (definitely had better hibachi steak, & fried rice was disappointing). Props for the atmosphere, service, and relatively moderate pricing (for these kind of places)

GREAT  food  and really high prices  so it is good but i dont think it is worth it  i felt like all you are paying for is their obviously high rent due to the "trendy" location  i'll go back but not often
Lively atmosphere and great service.  Cocktails were tasty.  Sushi rolls were very tasty and fresh. Really enjoyed the food. We enjoyed the experience and will be back!!!

We just got home and had T H E best Nakama dinner yet. We've been going to Nakama for years and have never had the amazing experience that we did tonight.   The shining star was our chef, Tom. Right from the start - great eye contact and great communication with our table - my husband and me, and a couple with a 7 yr old - a very engaging young lady. Tom didn't miss a beat and truly made her experience (and ours) special. He made sure to ask if anyone was allergic to anything, .... handed her the tools and challenged her to do cook, he made the rice into a heart, the veggies into a 'U' and the 3 pieces of chicken in the fist column stacked to make an 'I'. The 'I' 'Love''U' was a first for us and Tom seemed so pleased. And so were we. He showed he was having a good time and it was contagious. The food was amazing -  - Bob's Delight and I had the shrimp/scallops/tuna. My husband agreed that our meals were the best yet at Nakama-in both flavor and the correct temperature.    We'll be back in two weeks and will ask for Tom. Hope he's working then too!

The manager, Sun, was awful. She had no customer service or hospitality skills at all. She served me the wrong sushi roll and told me I was wrong (um, hello the customer is always right) and she was giving our amazing waitress, Ashley, a hard time and arguing with her about the WRONG sushi roll. Ashley and Ryan, the servers, had amazing personalities and showed my table amazing hospitality. Besides the good sushi rolls (when I finally got the one I ordered) I would not recommend coming here at all. We also waited an hour for our table when we had a reservation.

Had sushi and sashimi for lunch this week. Very generous portions and fresh. Have recently been to Tamari and Yamato and this was the best, with Tamari a close second.  Only issue was seating. We wanted a table for a meeting, but had to sit at the sushi bar because tables are limited.

A few friends and I went to Nakama for dinner after spending the afternoon at Skybar nearby.  We all had on bathing suits WITH cover ups.  In particular, one of my friends and I were wearing almost identical outfits (sheer dresses over out bathing suits) except that she even had shorts on under her dress.  She is black and I am white.  The manager on duty approached her and asked her to leave because she was not "obeying the dress code" but he didn't say anything to me, in an arguably more revealing outfit.  When she asked him for clarification, he asked did she want to speak to the owner and she said yes, to which he replied, "well he's not here."  I can completely understand upholding a dress code, but I cannot comprehend selective dress codes.  If her outfit was unacceptable, then so was mine and we should have both been asked to leave but he ONLY said something to her!  He then proceeded to call the police and told them that my friend was "causing a scene" (she wasn't.)  I will never set foot in this racist establishment again!
Never a bad experience here. Chef Tom is an amazing entertainer and cook!  He was especially attentive to my 3 and 4 year olds that loved him.

now i sympathize with a lot of the reviews for nakama, but in 3 separate experiences i've never had anything close to a 1 star time.  our most recent trip led us to the sushi bar where the service was lightning-fast and karma-friendly.  (our waitress forgot to charge a salmon roll and ended up comping it in the end)    it may be overpriced, but isn't all sushI?  the red dragon roll was worth every cent as was the hanalei.  i've never ventured to the hibachi side of the road, and i just have a feeling that you'll be better off sticking to the sushi.    cheer up pretentious sushites and remember that you're in pittsburgh, not osaka!  PS. nobody's mentioned that Nakama's cougar population is flourishing.

After an afternoon Pirates game, 3 of us sat up at the sushi bar and ordered fairly common sushi and sashimi. It was fresh and tasty. We also ordered a bowl of chicken fried rice that my husband claimed was the best he had ever had ( I think they cooked it with a LOT of butter). We watched the sushi chefs prepare way more interesting looking dishes while we waited for our food and enjoyed the atmosphere. Our waitress, Lauren, was a giant bag. That is my only complaint.  Not sure if we were just really luck to get the 3 seats as we walked in or what??  There was a constant line up in the waiting area so maybe we were lucky.

So...  I usually only eat in the Sushi bar/bar area because I am not into the whole hibachi thing.  This place is usually very busy for Happy Hour, so if you just want to eat and not worry about a crowd, try a different place or come at a different time.  Otherwise, it can be amusing to people watch here.    Personally, I come for the Sushi.  Ever since my friend introduced me to the Hanalei roll, I can't resist it.  Shrimp tempura, cream cheese, some other stuff, then tempura batter fried.  Tastes so much better than it sounds, worth the $14 price tag (if done right) as it is double the standard sized roll.  The other rolls are all decent and the sashimi servings are huge.  If you are on a first date, beware - the pieces of sushi are so gigantic that you'll either 1) look like a pig stuffing it all into your mouth or 2) risk having the entire piece fall apart all over you as you try to daintily take normal bite sizes out of the sushi-piece.  You decide whether you will go for option 1 or 2!  Oh, and just say NO to the tempura appetizer.  It's not tempura, that would actually be Japanese style.  No, what you will get if you order the tempura is American-style beer-battered shrimp and 3 pieces of vegetables, all for 11 bucks.  Blech.  Service is always a bit shoddy in the bar area, but to be fair, that place gets crazy busy.  So...  Food, 4; Service 2-3 depending on the night and business; atmosphere, 3.  But hey, if you just want that busy happy hour scene, this is a place to go to!  P.S.  Parking can be a pain.  It's Carson in the Southside, what do you expect?

Was here on a Wednesday night and the place was packed. Luckily it was just the two of us so we were able to sit at the sushi bar right away and you get the whole menu at the sushi bar which was a good thing since hubby wanted steak hibachi.  The onion soup came with our meal and was nice and spicy. We had the Hamachi, toro, sake, tamago, all nice and tasty and the nice sweet tamago. The caterpillar roll was very good and we also had the spicy yellow tail roll which was ok.  Service was fast, really fast considering how busy they were.  Prices are comparable to all other Japanese steakhouses, the steak hibachi was $28.00, the rolls were 10.99, 6.99, 5.99  They have valet parking ($7) which was nice since we are from out of town and had no idea where to park.  Talking with people there, they are always very busy and have 600 reservations on Saturdays, so if hitting it on a weekend or if you want to sit at the hibachi tables I would make a reservation.  We both said we would come back. Only complaint I have is the sushi bar is near the door and I was cold. If you're at the hibachi tables I'm sure you'd be nice and warm ;)  One question: What is with the cards on the ceiling?

An amazing Valentine's Day with June and her staff! So over the top good that we had to write up a  review.  Wife has recently discovered she's gluten intolerant, so going out has been a real pain. But both the waitress and bartender bent over backwards to find out if X or Y piece of sushi had gluten in it.   The sushi we did end up getting was amazing, and they accidentally brought out extra rolls for us, and then offered to take them off our bill as we didn't order them.   Eventually, June came over and chatted with my wife for awhile; my wife got a little soy sauce on her white sweater, so June ran over, got some club soda and a napkin and was actually blotting out the stain on her sweater.   Seriously, amazing service, amazing food.

The food was overpriced mediocre hibachi. The rice wasn't cooked well enough, and the hibachi chicken was tough. Everyone I went with got food poisoning after as well.   Everything needed to be seasoned more, too.

I remember this place being awesome....not the case anymore. The restaurant felt dirty, the food mediocre and the prices way too high. Also, the employees all looked a mess with dirty pants, mis matched uniforms etc.  I am very surprised the owner/manager let this place fall so hard.

I've been to Nakama three times...each time worse than the last...shame on me for continuing to go...but there is an absolute dearth of places to go in Pittsburgh.    I had a reservation on Opentable; they cancelled the reservation but didn't fail to accept my money.  The server was beyond untrained.  They forgot at least three of the items we ordered.  We brought our own wine and they charged us a $30 corkage fee when the last time I was there they charged us $15.  I asked to speak to the manager who got angry that the last person hadn't charged us $30...that is THE HIGHEST CORKAGE FEE IN PITTSBURGH...and at a tired, mediocre restaurant.    I don't right negative reviews...I realize places have, like people, bad days...but it's clear this restaurant is on a precipitous slide from the peaks of mediocrity to much worse.  STAY AWAY!!!
A wonderful sushi joint, which hosts the best appetizer ever (the tuna and avocado).   If you're looking for a one of a kind sushi experience definitely visit.
This is my first time here.  Service marginal.  Bar tender not very friendly.  Shrimp were like eating rubber. Way over cooked.  I won't be back.

Nakama: Overall, I give three stars due to okay food and varying levels of service.  Service: I came here for my friend's birthday. We had a pretty large party and made reservations ahead of time. When we got there, we ended up still waiting for another thirty minutes or so, which was fine with us. What got us a little annoyed was how the hostess was not kind to us or anyone else that was there at the time. When we were getting seated, they were unsure where to seat us and we had to walk around the restaurant once before settling.  Our waitress was one of the sweetest people ever. Her name was Stephanie and I want to say how much I appreciated having her as our waitress. The whole restaurant is loud and super crowded, and she remained calm and helpful throughout the entire night. I would often see her running from place to place.  The manager was also very sweet. My girlfriend made an ice cream cake for our friend and he was the one who brought it out for us, helped us cut it, and even washed the cake pan afterwards. He is obviously very proactive in customer satisfaction. In addition, the restaurant didn't charge us extra for all of this, which many restaurants do.  Food: Food was only okay for me. I got the chicken diabolo and my girlfriend got the steak. The chicken was not fresh, extremely dry, and chewy. The steak was not the greatest either, it seemed to have the same problems of being a little dry and chewy, not as bad as my chicken was though. I was definitely very full after all of this though, it was a lot of food. If I ever come back, most likely, I will get the shrimp, since that was pretty good.  This was my first Hibachi restaurant experience. While I understand the excitement of the show, etc., I don't think it's worth it for the quality of the food.

This is my favorite restaurant. The whole thing is fun to watch, and thought that would be their gimmick, but the food turned out to be amazing.  I've never liked any seafood but their shrimp appetizer is so good! The only place I'd ever eat seafood (besides my occasional bouts with sushi).  I got Chicken & Steak hibachi dinner all three times I've been there. I got filets the third time for the steak and it was worth the extra three dollars.  It is kind of sad that the performance of the hibachi chefs varies a lot from person to person, as the second time I went was by far the nicest to watch, but all three were very good.  This is my birthday restaurant now. ;)

My boyfriend and I walked in to have dinner, and requested to be sat at the sushi bar. The host pointed to where we could seat ourselves but then quickly shouted that she needed to take our Starbucks because she couldn't allow any outside drinks. We looked around puzzled because there was a dirty table beside us with an empty Starbucks cup. She refused to let us drink our coffees so we unfortunately left. Terrible customer service. She should have offered to pour our coffees into one of their own cups.

I've tried to like Nakama, I really have. There is a serious shortage of good sushi in the Southside.....as in there are only two places to go for it. With the renovation and new ownership of the old Sushi Two into Tokyo Bistro, Nakama has dropped to last place (or 2nd), for Sushi in south side.   Nakama has style. The interior is gorgeous. This is where it all ends and goes south though. The food is very uninspired, the waits for a table are unbelievable (and unwarranted), presentation has gone downhill over the years - and the worst part: the crowd.  For some reason, Nakama has turned into a singles scene. Please explain to me how a sushi & hibachi restaurant is now a meat-market? (fish market? hehe) Any given night of the week, you will find scantily clad fake women (could be a good thing), and old rich perverts trying to pick them up......cougars, suburbanites, screaming children....it's nuts. At peak dinner hours, you literally have to fight your way through everything. You'd think you stepped into Town Tavern by accident or something!  The other issue, and the reason why I am marking it bad for groups, is the lack of larger tables dedicated solely to sushi eaters. If you have a large group of people, you may as well pass. You can either camp out and wait for a bunch of seats to open up at the sushi bar, or sit at a hibachi grill - which is terrible for the cook if everyone in your party wants sushi.  Here are some final pros to balance this out a little bit and explain why I gave it two stars:  - Great drinks...best bloody mary I've had. - Awesome for late night food once it clears out - Good lunch specials - The aforementioned interior space  But if you really want good sushi, go to Umi in Shadyside or Pennsylvania Fish Company on Penn Ave in the strip. Nakama is not the place.
I love this place, i wouldn't call this real sushi, but its still really good!

The food is good. I've  never had the sushi but Ive heard  it's very good. I only gave 3 stars bc the service is AWFUL   The manager is a pompous asshole,  Is annoyed at life And  doesn't care if you have a complaint. Acts like your disrupting his life if you have a concern.  I've eaten here and had a few good experiences but I've also has really awful experiences as well and haven't been back

I ate at Nakama for the first time last night, sat at the sushi bar with two friends, ordered a ton of food, and an expensive bottle of sake (which was over priced and soso in quality). Despite the money we dropped, the service was horrible, simply put; unprofessional, rude, and snotty.  Now, this place has nothing to be uppity about: THEY DO NOT EVEN UNDERSTAND WHAT SUSHI IS. It was Americanized to the extreme, the menu was embarrassing, as with the wine and sake list. The sashimi was so poorly cut you could barley chew on it, the maki was not tightly rolled. And the fish... oh the fish, no flavor.  The hipster crowd should of tipped me off, this is place for people who do not know anything about dining, and probably only eat sushi because they think it's the cool thing to do. The crowd was nothing but meat heads and trashy looking girls, the music selections we're bottom of the barrel, and the blaring sports tv's would ruin anyones dinner who cares.

I used to frequent Nakama constantly, but the past few times I went the service was horrendous. The most recent time was the worst I have ever seen. A friend & I decided to sit at the bar & not only was the bartender rude, she acted as if we didn't exist! It took her 15 minutes to even look at us to take our order, then when it was finally ready we watched as she chatted with her friends rather than take it over to us. Nakama isn't THAT great, so when the service is bad.. Theres no point in going, I'll be going to Lil Tokyo next time I get a sushi/hibachi craving!

Don't go here if you are gluten free. Our server was pretty clueless and they couldn't prepare gf sushi. My food was cooked in the back, came out cold and I had half of what everyone else had. Had a reaction to my food. Def got glutened.  Also had to ask several times for water. My friend got the complete wrong sushi order.   Not a great time at all.

I witnessed my friend who was intoxicated at the bar was taken advantage of by the bartender ( male working Sunday 8/14/16 around 5pm) someone needs to check the cameras and action needs to be taken. The gentleman paid $100 for his tab and he was clearly really drunk and when they gave him his change he only gave him $6 dollars back and when he confronted the bartender about it he had the rest of his change sitting on top of the register. This was extremely awarkward to watch someone being taken advantage of and to see the bartenders face when he caught him was something unreal. Really messed up when you go to a nice restaurant like Nakama and have an employee do something like that. Really makes you think twice of going there in the future ( or makes you realize that you need to count your money because there are people out there like that )
Love this place! Soup is delicious ...sake bomb...awesome.... Hibachis always great...go for lunch ...much cheaper less packed

Friday May 15 my friend had reservations for 9:00PM for a surprise birthday dinner at Nakama. Because of Nakama's strict seating policy when it comes to reservations, she spoke directly to a manager, and requested that the guests be allowed to sit before the guest of honor arrived so that it would in fact be a "surprise". The manager agreed and assured her that there would be no problem granting that request.   The guests arrived at 8:30 PM and informed the host that we were all present for our 9 PM reservation. The host told us we would be called when it was available.   We were still waiting in the bar to be seated at 10PM. An hour after the guest of honor arrived, (so much for the surprise). When we were finally seated everyone ordered appetizers and drinks right away. It took 20 minutes to receive our drinks. And believe me, I'm not exaggerating for effect here; I was timing it on my watch. My appetizers arrived at about 10:30.    We placed our dinner orders shortly before the apps showed up, which would be around 10:25. The chef did not arrive to start cooking until 10:50.   I addressed this with the server who gave me excuses about the shortage of chefs and how they were backed up, but I noticed people who arrived after us, who were also seated before us (with comparable party numbers) were almost finished with their meals before our chef arrived.  The waiter clearly didn't understand that I wasn't interested in excuses and passed me onto a manager. The manager apologized and went to grab a chef for us. However when the meal was finally cooked and served it was 11:30. All after we were supposed to be seated at 9.   On of the couple's who was with us, never received an appetizer after waiting for 1.5 hours. The appetizer was Ahi Tuna, which requires NO cooking. The manager offered a free dinner, but by that time our friends were so disgusted that they left.   I have to say that we were one of the last tables to leave the seating area, which was after midnight. We spent way too much money on drinks while we were waiting to be seated and eat our dinner. No one at the table was compensated for the aggravation. One of the girls at the table is a newscaster for channel 4, and I would love to see her comment on the negative experience we had.   I strongly urge people who are interested in a hibachi style dining experience to seek other venues. If it is sushi you are interested in, try the Downtown Fish Market, Umi, or Yakoso.

May be a decent place to eat hibachi...BUT NOT sushi or sashimi!!!!  I have tried Nakama's 3 times to be fair.  Nakama can not live up to it's name as a "Sushi Bar".  Don't waste your time, money or taste buds....

Excellent food, excellent service. The Signature long rolls were delicious and the Nigiri cut was thick and satisfying.  The service was prompt and accurate, despite some complicated orders.   Highly recommended

Review for Bar/Scene Only:  My mom says my crackface cousin (she doesn't call him that) raves about this place.  My random childhood friend's boss told me I should come here to meet interesting people.    I went for drinky times.  I brought a City Paper with me, as I was alone and needed some entertainment.  I sat at the bar for about 20 minutes, watching everyone around me get served.  Two large, bald headed gentlemen sidled up and were taken care of immediately by the bartender.  Still nothing in front of me.    Eventually I was asked "Are you OK?" at which point I requested a drink list.  Now, I don't really go in for too much mixed alcohol or sweet stuff, so I ended up just ordering a Pearl (cold-unfiltered) sake.  I'm not sure what people see in this place.  I mean, the bar scene is almost all large and/or old(er) people who usually happen to be bald if they possess a scrotum.  I mean, that's fine, that's cool.  Just not what I consider a "happening scene".    Also, my bartender made me taste the sake before giving it to me.  I thinke maybe he thought I didn't know what I was ordering.  To be fair, I was the only one in the whole bar drinking sake, so maybe they don't sell that much of it.  The food may be tasty, but I was warned that it would "give me the poops".  Can't verify that though.    Has anyone else noted the playing cards stuck to the ceiling?  That's pretty cool.  I also like the exposed pipes.  It's really not so bad from a design standpoint.  Just a Pittsburgh kind of place, I guess...

Love, love, love! We drive to Pitt every 4-6 weeks and my husband and I stop by whenever we can. I always get sushi, my favorite is the Nakama roll. My husband usually gets a full meal which he always enjoys. Drinks are always amazing as well. It's a little pricey for the area (I guess compared to DC is average), but well worth it!

I love the food and love the feel. The only thing that left me a bit cold was the bartending staff. I have been there three times on business trips and each time they seemed to be indifferent at best, except when my bill came and I got a huge smile and a "Have a wonderful night." which was about as sincere as a campaign promise.

Went there Friday night for Sushi.  We had 3 different roles and tgey were amazing.  Ordered 2 more nagiri pieces that were great. The fish was fresh and flavour was good. Will definitely go back for sushi.

I love this place.  I have been to Pittsburg for business several times and I always make sure one night for dinner I stop in.  I have never ate on the hibachi side, but I LOVE there sushi.  The crowd is always lively and upbeat.  You will crave this place every time you set foot in Pittsburg.

Used to be a staple on Carson but has really disappointed over the last few years. Still a pretty good meal but the service and flair are completely gone. The hibachi used to be so entertaining but now it's basically just watching someone awkwardly cook for you. Sushi is tasty but no options that really stand out. Table service is usually not great and the bartenders seem to use their phones more than mixing tins. Still a place I will go every now and again but there are many better options for this type of fare around the city.

Went to this "sushi" restaurant last night and had hands down the worst sushi of my life.  Shrimp tempura was beer batter, not tempura.  Seaweed salad was hard - how does that even happen?  Sushi was mushy with overcooked rice and too much of it.  Also the habachi fried rice tasted like burnt soy sauce with a sprinkling of dirt.  The atmosphere left me feeling as if I forgot my too short skirt, spray tan and box of condoms.  The waitress was very sweet and had our entire meal comped.  We tipped her generously and ran for the door.
Great location in Southside and good if you want to fulfill a Hibachi craving. However, not the greatest Hibachi, nor the most authentic either. It's also really loud in the restaurant.

Much like Geisha House in LA, Nakama is all about the "pizazz." I remember when this place used to be a RITE AID, and now it has a massive coy fish on the front of it. I'm not going to diss Nakama, because I actually really like Nakama. I've gone here on many different occasions: for family and friend gatherings, work-related lunches, or just for drinks. This was where I first learned how to properly use chopsticks. It definitely gets a lot of hype, and sometimes you can't even get a seat, but that's because the hibachi is so damn good. They have this creamy sauce that is out of this world, I know several people who order extra just to take home. The whole experience is nice, really. The sushi is better than average and the hibachi is great, too, but I usually go with anything "surf n' surf" (all seafood). The scallops are some of the best around, but a bit on the small side, if I remember correctly. Very good with the cream sauce I mentioned. Don't know what it is, but there's a reason why they keep it a secret. The service is a number one priority, at least from my experiences.  Don't go for the hibachi if you're not in the mood to sit with other people, unless you have a large group. I took my folks once, and I don't think they were totally into it, but it's nice for younger people or a party.

Avoid the hibachi and save yourself from the rest of the night on the toliet!   Had the hibachi sesame chicken, my husband had the hibachi steak. First course onion soup was super salty, tasted like it was hot water with beef ramen seasoning. Salad was decent enough. Veggies served first then meat. Bland- nothing special. Certainly not worth $50. They also serve this nasty "shrimp sauce" which is basically thousand island dressing. I was worried about the food safety on the hibachi "chef's" cart. Kinda grimey-lookin.  Worst part was that later that night, both of us got sick from eating there. I'm talking sick like from the movie Bridesmaids.  It was bad. Spend your money elsewhere.
We had a great lunch today. Food was quick n fresh as usual. And the service from the blonde bartender was on point. She was very sweet

The food is great if you are there for food and if it was still 2005.  The sushi is sub-par and on more than one occasion I've left their feeling a bit ill from it.   As another reviewer wrote, "Nakama has turned into a singles scene. "  I don't understand this phenomenon either as if you are there for more than 5 minutes you cannot go anywhere else without smelling like the inside of that place. You also have to wash your clothes twice to get it out, it's almost worse than cigarette smoke.

Good fresh sushi. Get the appetizers if you can. We had the seared NY strip, which was delicious and $9.99 for quite a large portion of steak. The crab fritters were pretty good and crab-y if you are in the mood for something fried and not soaking in oil. We didn't do the hibachi, but the sushi was good. The toro jalapeno roll was pretty creative. The food is NOT overpriced for the whole package. Yes it is a bit "uppity" if you mean no one is really wearing their XXL Steelers shirt and the servers and patrons actually care what they look like. It is not a place to get a $5 roll.

So I'm in town working and went and sat at the bar to get a quick dinner before a show.  They had a dry Riesling on the menu and I confirmed with the waitress that it wasn't sweet.  So I get it that this is a strip of tattoo parlors, vape stores and college bars, but there are also quite a few great restaurants hidden around the area.  So, I was a littel surprised when my wine was beyond syrupy.  Then I ordered a specialty roll.  Honestly, I ordered a cooked tempura sushi with avocado.  It came drowned in about three different sauces.  It wasn't compelling. On the positive side, service was fast and friendly. The place was crowded and people seemed to be having a great night. I won't be going back.

Wife and I went on NYE. I got the blue crab and red dragon rolls. They were decent, but something was missing.  This is especially true with the blue crab roll. My wife got the shrimp hibachi and said it was equal to Little Tokyo and Benihanna.   The service was okay, but they did put an extra chair on our table which made it a little cramped.   It gets a 3 and not a 3.5 because the bathroom had an attendant.  Not only that, but he had pictures of scantily clad overweight women sitting above the urinal. Dafuq?

Food is overpriced.  Like, a lot.  Ginger dressing is horrid.  Usually the ginger salad is one of my favorite things at sushi joints, I look forward to it.  I ate two bites and pushed the bowl away.  The hibachi was overpriced and not that great.  The fried rice had no egg in it and just didn't seem like the typical.  Wasn't filled with flavor and they put two huge pieces of fat on my plate with the steak.   Ugh???  Is that normal?  Also, the miso soup was like super miso.  Spicy and odd.  But, and this is a big but, because without this there would be one star:  the bartender/server.  I don't know his name but he has a tattoo over his collarbone.  He is amazing, nice, attentive and made the trip to Nakama okay.  He needs to run this joint.  Otherwise, I hate to say it because I like new restaurants in our area, skip this place.  Go to ichiban instead.

If they had 4.5 stars, I would rate them higher than 4. This place is rad! It gets really busy, so I highly recommend reservations or sitting at the bar. Don't pay attention to the 3 star review because this place deserves more than that! Service is great and one of the great things about sitting at the bar is you can watch them make your roll right there in front of you. We ordered 3 different rolls and each one was fresh, unique, and on point. Give it a shot!

Not sure why the low reviews but this is one of my favorite Habachi places in Pittsburgh.  If everyone is mad about the wait for a seat, then reserve a table!!  The food is absolutely amazing, and the waiters are very nice as well.  This is a great place to grab dinner but don't forget lunch!  The food is quite pricey, a dinner plate at the grill can cost you a quick $25, and that's not including drinks and sushi.  Tab for two people including drinks is usually about $100, well worth it if you ask me.  Right after dinner you can find a great place to grab drinks in the South Side.  If you're complaining about the price, just don't go everyday!

I recently went to Nakama for the first time for a first date - many firsts that night. Starting with the bad: We made dinner reservation for 7:15 and were a few minutes late. We were told that we lost our spot and had the choices to either wait a half hour to 45 minutes, sit at the sushi bar, or just order food at a table without the hibachi experience. We opted to get a drink at the bar  and wait it out. This was a Wednesday evening and the place was packed. No seats available at first so we checked out the drink menu and finally we got a couple of chairs.   The drinks were decent - I'm a lightweight so they were good for me. It worked out that we waited for the hibachi because we were able to be squeezed in within ten minutes.    I got Hibachi Seasame Chicken and my date got Nakama Tuna Steak. He also ordered sushi but our waiter had forgotten to bring it- It was really no problem because the portion sizes are pretty big and we probably couldn't have ate the sushi anyways.   I have no complaints about my chicken - It definitely exceeded my expectations based on the other reviews I have seen for it. My date goes there on the regular and so his Tuna Steak obviously has his coming back for more. The Onion Soup was by far one of the better Japanese soups I have had. It has a kick to it that I haven't tasted anywhere else.   Our hibachi chef was wonderful. He was entertaining, easy to talk to and was really good at his job. He even let us all try a little fried rice.   I always have had reservations about Nakama because I thought it was an overexposed restaurant that jacked its prices up because of its trendy reputation. I really enjoyed my time there. It was clean and had a lot of energy. I'll be back again.

Tried to have lunch here but ended up leaving after waiting 15 minutes for a beer. No wonder the place was 1/2 empty. Talked with manager and she offered me a free beer but I could not have it after being being upset by the waitress. Was really looking forward to a nice meal but now they are off my list

The foods can vary a lot in quality, unfortunately.   I had gone a couple weeks ago and gotten the Haiku roll due to the high praise, to see that the crabstick inside of it had a smokey/bitter taste to it that was very unpleasant. Additionally, the tempura shrimp resembled more of a boiled shrimp. It definitely was fried, but lacked any tempura batter or anything, making it to be kind of a waste of space inside the roll, which I really hate to say.  Additionally, the spicy chicken was extremely mushy and the outer coating would thus fall off the chicken.   However, the lobster roll is definitely the best. I would highly recommend it, despite the enormous price tag on it.   Overall, this restaurant uses a lot of rice in their sushi, which I do not mind! It allows the rolls to be of a greater size.

I will never go back to this damn nakama again. I made reservation on open table. When we arrived none of the hosts greeted us they were just standing and talking on the podium. I finally told them I had reservations and they escorted us to a table with a group. We didn't want to sit with a group we just wanted a table for two. So we ask if we could switch the seats they were offering us and they did. When the waiter arrived it was apparent he had an attitude. He asked us what we wanted to drink and was there anything else we wanted. We weren't given any menus I asked for a menu and he only brought us one menu and there was two of eating. After noticing his rude and annoying attitude wasn't going away, we decided to just get up and leave without even ordering. This nakama has the worst service.
A gimick place.  Nice place for tourists.  Ate at the bar and was ignored throughout my meal.  Probably didn't spend enough money on the slip to be treated like a person.  No need to say anymore!

Not worth it.  We showed up at 6:15pm on Sunday night for dinner thinking we'd have more than enough time to make an 8pm movie. We didn't get out of there until 7:45. The service was SO slow. There was one bartender/server for the entire sushi side. She had zero urgency and seemed to cater to a few men at the bar while the diners and other bar patrons sat waiting.   It took twenty minutes for her to bring us water and take a drink order. She then proceeded to refill everyone's drink, take orders, and get new drinks for her favorite bar patrons before making my boyfriend's drink. It took over thirty minutes from when we walked in to get one drink.   The food was good, but not worth the price. This is a restaurant in a strip mall in the suburbs. To spend over $100 for horrible service and mediocre food isn't worth it.

Boy, has this place changed over the years! The price has always been steep, but it used to be that you would get great, fresh food, service and entertainment in return. Not anymore.   The wait staff is generally sour and unprofessional. We came in on a Monday afternoon and they clearly struggled to find hibachi seating arrangements during this slow period.   Luckily, on this Monday, we were able to get the one chef with a modicum of talent and personality. When Nakama first opened, all of the chefs were friendly and full of tricks. That's what we come for. The whole point of hibachi restaurants is to be entertained, not just sit around a sweaty table. Most of Nakama's chefs nowadays will just sit there in silence as they grill your steak.   The food is still good for the most part, although the sushi isn't very fresh, and they have a tendency to bring appetizers during or after your main course.   A lot has changed over the years. Between the loud music on weekends, reward cards, and specials, it's clear Nakama is trying to do too much instead of just concentrating on good hibachi. The bar makes a killing on weekends, though, so I doubt they'll change.   As an aside, they have a broken "gong" that they ring on your birthday, except that they deaden the noise, so it sounds like a fork hitting a table. Come on guys!
Some of the best sushi I've ever had....and I come from the East Coast.  Unreal toro, have some of it's available.

When you ass black ladies that they're not welcome because they have on a bathing suit and they are covered with dresses and or shorts and tops but the girls next to them can be with their boobs hanging out showing the Coots where is that the right thing to doask one group to leave who were swimming covered in their bathing dresses and shorts while people sitting in the restaurant got the slip down almost falling out shorts so short you can see their Hoochie what is going on here

Cold average. Sushi was just OK, rubbery and a bit soggy. Also had 2 apps and miso soup. Korean BBQ lettuce wrap was overcooked and chewy, served with a cut iceberg lettuce cheek that was barely the size of my small hand. The chicken nakatori was 2 pieces of over cooked, dry thigh meat on a stick for $8.99??? Nope. Rarely complain about price. This place just doesn't give you the quality that the price demands. Soup was great. This was my 3rd and last disappointing taste.

If I could give this place negative stars, I absolutely would. Had a reservation for 10 last Friday. Hung out at the bar area while waiting for all members of our dinner party to arrive. My friend was attempting to order a drink from bartender Susan (dark, curly hair) and was met with a rude "you're gonna have to wait" response from her. (Keep in mind that the bar was not overly busy at this point in time) My friend was talking among the group about the extremely poor service he had just received. Susan overheard and began to scream at my friend in front of the whole bar. I would say it was the most unprofessional thing I had ever witnessed by a customer service employee, but the manager Sun took the cake on that. Susan called Sun over and complained about my friend. Without hesitation, Sun removed my friend's drink from his hand and asked him to leave. At no point did Sun attempt to hear my friend's point of view. Needless to say, we took our business elsewhere. I approached Sun and calmly asked why my friend was kicked out. Her response was "he started yelling first" which could not have been further from the truth. I told her we would be cancelling our reservation for the evening, to which she responded "bye". This was my first and last Nakama experience. I will NEVER step foot in that place again. I'll eat gas station sushi before I give them my money. If you're thinking about dining here, do yourself a favor and cancel while you still can. Or at the very least, make sure Sun and Susan aren't working.

I love sushi - and even though Nakama is always extremely busy and crowded, they have a great sushi menu.  I had the avocado and Philadelphia roll when I was last here, but one young chef was very sweet and gave my friend and me an entire roll for free.  You can't beat that!

This is another one of those typical Hibachi style Japanese places.   The food was okay.   The rice was cooked until it was crunchy; one of my pet peeves.  The place as also VERY LOUD.  You couldn't hear anyone else talk unless they were right next to you.  I don't think I will be back.
Bland food no showmanship no conversation my noodles were still cold. . . Probably the worst hibachi I have ever experienced. . .I definitely do not recommend it
The food is reasonable but the place is great for an evening for some good dressing up with some good drinks. The ambience is great but it can get a little too hot near the grills...

Always enjoyed this place. Had a horrible experience. Host was unorganized. Soda was flat in our mixed drinks, they brought out more soda to fix it, we had to demand new drinks. Soup was really spicy.  Our sushi came out on someone else's plate, they picked at it around their order and sent it back, the sushi chef just re-plated it and gave it to us (gross).  Food was average at best, cook was good though, portions were big.  Server came back once during dinner.  Messed the whole tables checks up and we waited 30 some minutes just to leave after we boxed our food, so we left cash and walked out, paying for our overcharges. Manager no where to be found.  I would avoid this place after this experience.  We used to frequent this place years ago!  What a shame it went so down hill!

This review is for the sushi bar. I found the fish to be somewhat rubbery and the rice soggy. The rolls were not wrapped tightly causing me to separate the fish to eat as an inspired sashimi.   I found the atmosphere as most Pittsburgh sushi restaurants to be somewhat tacky. To lure the crowds in they have the loud hibachi tables setup for the novelty inspired Pittsburghers. I sat at the sushi bar where the oil infused exhaust from the hibachi tables crept over leaving for a somewhat ghastly atmosphere.  The waitress reminded me of someone from Applebee's, ultra chipper, bubbly and unable to answer basic questions about the fish. The prices were much higher than other sushi restaurants in the area and based on several recommendations I can only conclude that Nakama is over rated when it comes to sushi. I refuse to lower myself to sit at or eat from a hibachi table so maybe by these standards this Wexford establishment is superior to others.
This is a popular spot in Pittsburgh's South Side. Over the past few years the quality of the food has declined. It is still good and fun so give it a try.

Came here with my friend who's local and she introduced me to this amazingly delicious place. I ordered the tropical roll and she had a tempura Philly cheese roll. We share crab fritters and had a glass of wine with it. Everything was so delicious! I loved every minute of my experience there. The waiter was super attentive and friendly. The food was quick and fresh. I will most definitely return again in the near future.

I have not eaten in a Nakama restaurant, but the stuff that they pawn off as lo mein at PPG Paints Arena was terrible. I chose chicken lo mein. The noodles were completely dry and devoid of any sauce or other ingredients. A handful of cubed generic chicken (which looked like an afterthought) was thrown on top. Very disappointed, paid $12.00 for dry noodles and a small serving of chicken.   I'm aware that the food is not prepared there and cannot be compared to the quality of their restaurant food, but if I were responsible for this presentation I would be embarrassed. Very poor quality.  This being said, I would not hesitate dining at a Nakama restaurant. I have heard good things from many people, but if you're going to PPG Paints Arena avoid the Nakama lo mein.

Finally made it here for sushi -  I've been putting it off  as I'm not a fan of sitting at the sushi bar  That said, the chefs didn't even make eye contact, so I was perfectly happy. Yeah, yeah, antisocial...  :)  They're docked a star from my perspective because there is no option to the bar/sushi bar area if you don't want hibachi and if someone is with you who doesn't like sushi, they are stuck eating off of the appetizer menu.  I always start with basic items when ordering sushi at a new restaurant - had salmon, tuna, shrimp and eel nigiri and a cucumber maki.  The fish was fresh, with decent texture, the cucumber was crispy, and overall Nakama might have taken over the number 2 sushi restaurant spot in my heart.

Went with a group and sat at the sushi bar. Service was not so good. One person's meal was served after the other three of us had several orders of sushi. We ordered two orders of sashimi and only one was on the platter. Quality of sushi ok. One was stringy. Valet returned car keys because they were going to leave early.

I went with a group of friends to try the new Nakama. I had never been to the original one, but had heard the hype.  My expectations were high.  I want to give them credit for being new, but they should have had their act together for 8pm at night.  The entire visit was a mess. The service was unstable and poor. The ingredients in my sushi were stale or over ripe.  The salad had WAY too much dressing- but I suppose that's my fault.  It's possible I will try there again in a few months, but for the prices, the food and service should be impeccable.

Renee,  I do not even know where to begin on thanking you and your team!  Everything was absolutely amazing! The menu's were festive and I thank you for doing them!  We had no trouble with valet and they were some of the nicest guys! They were so accommodating with our cars and needs! They even offered to run people's leftovers to their cars!  How many places would do that and how many places would let you leave your cars there? Probably, NONE! The servers went above and beyond and were some of the nicest servers I ever had! The one that is going back to school and we had on his last night was great! Most people probably would have just wanted to end their shift and be done. Not him!  He was everywhere, kept me in the know, took care of the bill for me and really was WONDERFUL!  I am sad for you he is leaving because he had to be one of the best you had!   They kept the drinks filled and were really on top of things!  The chefs were great, talkative, and did awesome tricks! The food was absolutely amazing from the appetizers to the entrees! I LOVED it all and received many compliments! The manager on duty (sorry I didn't get his name) went above and beyond as well!  He let us leave all the leftovers on a back table and brought us markers to write our names on the boxes.  Not many places would be so extremely accommodating and I have witnessed this first hand!  I cannot believe how much you all did for us! Most importantly, thank you especially for all you did to make this night perfect and my job that much easier and better!  You all are the best and you work with some amazing people!  Thank you again from the bottom of my heart!  Have a very Merry Christmas and a safe and Happy New Year!  Amanda

I had the best experience at Nakama tonight. I am lactose intolerant and told the waitress, the amount of attention I got and the effort the staff went though to make my meal lactose free was amazing! The staff was so friendly, food was amazing and our waitress Jess was great! We also got to meet the owners an they are the nicest people. My friends and I come here once a month and always have a great experience! I recommend this restaurant to anyone that enjoys a friendly atmosphere and delicious food!

I don't get the attraction to this place. Maybe it's just because it's in the South Side and offers easy group dining.  My husband and I had a gift card and ate there saturday and we decided to sit at a small table in the bar area. Our spicy chicken appetizer was good  but nothing spectacular. Our meals were ok. Fried rice seemed bulk and not freshly made.  Their shrimp sauce was also not great.  Our drinks were really good and the service was really good. There are many other hibachi places I would choose over Nakama.

at Nakama Express in Greentree.  Horrible Service, it was wrong, and no one will correct the issue.  Don't even waste your time with the worthlessness that is this whole restaurant.  Part or the Corner Market & Ale in Greentree, I am so disappointed!

What an absolute dump. Staff sat chatting at a table drinking Starbucks while we waited for fifteen minutes for service. Three other staff passed us and never acknowledged our presence. As two of four patrons in the entire restaurant, I would have at least expected some recognition. The bathrooms and floors were absolute filthy. When we left, they finally acknowledged us and asked if they could help us. Too little, too late. Will never return.
Decent sushi spot in Pittsburgh.  There are better around but it's definitely worth a shot if you're craving sushi in the area.

Hibachi is overpriced and under quality as compared to Saga. My family all agree, Saga wins in atmosphere (Nakama is crowded with smaller tables placed to close together) , fried rice (Nakama charges almost $4 extra if you want fried rice which also loses to Saga in taste),  and Saga also wins in quality and price.  Service is a push as well as the chef ( I think the chef's show is always luck of the draw). Nakama wins in ginger sauce.

Sushi was okay.  Nothing special, but a little better than Little Tokyo.  Bartender was rude.  Made my French Kiss martini incorrectly (I watched as he poured an imitation chambord liquor).  Hiachi was okay.  Soup was way too salty.  Salad was good.  The chix and steak were pretty good.  Service was horrible.  Had to pass all used dishes to the waitress across the grill.  Will not hurry back.

ICK--avoid this place.  I took one bite of the sushi and stopped eating it.  It tasted funny and waaaaaay fishy.  Our chef wasn't Asian but some white guy who didn't knock my socks off.  All he did was toss some high sodium sauce on some veggies and meat, stir them around, and serve them on our plates.  My stomach hurt less than 1 hour after I ate there...'nuff said.

I've been here many times, and I do think the Hibachi is tasty, however, the service seems to get worse every time I'm here.  Server seemed very rushed, barely staying at the table for 1 minute to take orders.  Today, I had my 9 year old son with us.  He ordered a steak kids meal, which the menu states is steak, vegetables, rice, and ice cream for dessert.  He got no veggies (which I didn't even mention since he won't eat them anyway) but he ate all of his meal and was excited for ice cream.  The server never mentioned or brought it, so I asked, "he's supposed to get ice cream with his meal right?"  He says, "oh, let me check if we have any."  About 10 minutes later he comes back with our check and says, "sorry we're out of ice cream." My son says, "do you have any other dessert?" Server says, "No, but the Milkshake factory is a few doors down."  Really?!?!?  Your solution to being out of something is referring me to another establishment down the street?  Is Nakama buying him a milkshake? Otherwise, I don't know, but that just seems ridiculous to me.  He acted as if I was trying to get some freebie or something.  It says it comes with the meal.  At least offer the kid a pineapple or take a drink off the check or something.  No, I did not take it up with the manager because at this point I just wanted to get out of there.

Nakama is like the equivalent of reality TV on VH1 to the local Asian cuisine restaurants actually available in Pittsburgh.  It's seems like the thing to be, but there's much more fulfilling places that are way lighter in the pocket book that you can easily skip it after one try.  They own a great spot in Southside though so the prominent location creates dominant control of people's eyes and ears.    Got to Yokoso.

I'm definitely a Nakama fan!  Whenever I'm trying to think of a place to go for dinner for a special occasion or a night out, Nakama often comes to mind! We usually get the hibachi dinner and it's always delicious and fun to watch!  We usually get some sushi too!  I live in LA now, so I've definitely had some good sushi out here, but I think the sushi at Nakama is just as good.   My biggest complaint about this place is that it's way overpriced.  They charge you for all of these little extra things too, like fried rice, which I feel is pretty unnecessary.  The sushi is also overpriced in my opinion.  Overall though, I've always had a great time at Nakama and I love the food!  I would definitely recommend it!

We are definitely fans of this place.  Best Japanese steakhouse in Pittsburgh, which may not be saying all that much, but they actually do a good job.  Food quality is good, and the chefs are typically pretty entertaining.  I find the waitstaff to be a bit on the slow side, and I have no comment about the sushi (not my thing).  Plus, we saw Jordan Staal, Tyler Kennedy & Max Talbot there one night!  So if its good enough for the Stanley Cup champions, its good enough for me!

I'm a celiac and the cook carelessly made my food with wheat and I was informed after I ate half my meal... NEVER come here with an allergy, the cooks apparently "don't read the tickets" according to the manager.  P.S. Bathroom looked like an atom bomb when off.
The wait was way to long just to be seated, the service is mediocre and the prices are too high for sushi. Decided to go somewhere where I could actually be seated.
Good sushi Diablo noodles were enough for three to share with the veggie egg rolls and ginger salads Service was very good at the bar

I'm not sure if Susan is the worst bartender in the world but she ruined my night. If this is typical for Nakama's service I will never be back. I wish I could give 0 stars. I have never posted a review before but feel so strongly about her terrible service that I just had to.

Wonderful as always.  While very expensive, the food was delicious, the hibachi entertaining, and the ambiance appealing.  The sushi is some of the best I've ever had anywhere.  I would definitely eat here again!

Thus Japanese restaurant used to have hour long waits. We went in on a Sunday afternoon expecting to have a wait but there was none. That was good! Then I understood why. The food was good but not great! It was decent but not delicious. The chef was nice but forgettable. The waiter was memorable though! Very upbeat and friendly personality. Also it was very dark in the dining room. Not a plus.

Couldn't help but feel as though i was watching an episode of jersey shore as the bartender brought out sushi to her friends first, even though they ordered well after us. It was also brought out to only one part of our 3 person party at a time. We couldn't even eat together. It also took over ten minutes and two bartenders to make one glass of water....on a slow sunday afternoon, mind you Not a good sign.  Luckily the sushi is of good/great quality.

The three stars (really 3.5) is for the steak and chicken I ordered at the hibachi as I thought it was tender and seasoned well.  However, I didn't care for the fried rice I added on at all and there was a lot of waiting around.  It took an extremely long time to get any meat/protein.  Since it was cooked last you basically had to eat rice and vegetables if you wanted hot food or sit there and let your food get cold while you waited for the rest of it.  Initially I tried waiting for everything but it kind of got to the point of being ridiculous having food on the plate and just letting it sit there untouched for so long getting cold.

Well, I was very disappointed by our first meal here.   The sushi was delicious.   The service was ok.  Our server was nice but he kept trying to clear the table when we were still eating from plates.  I set my Chop sticks down to get a drink and he took my salad.   The chef was the worst part.   He cooked well but didn't have much flair.  I got rice in my eye and a piece of steak hit me when he was trying to toss it to my husband's plate.   The steak hit the table 3 times then hit me.   He didn't have all of the tables' meals on his cart and had to go back for part of an order after the whole meal was cooked and the person said don't I get scallops?   For what we paid we could have gone else where and had the same if not better hibachi.  I don't think any of us will be back.

Nikki was our waitress.  She worked so hard all night, not only for us, but for everyone in our section. Did a wonderful job for us considering we needed a new drink every five minutes!  She consistently asks if everyone is happy, which makes the dinner so much easier to enjoy.  Our chef was wonderful and cooked everything to perfection, along with asking the specifics when it came to little things we enjoyed about the meal.  Our valet service was also very personable and they made sure to open the door both times for my girl.  Really appreciate that.    I'll be coming here for years more.

This was my second visit to Nakama & it was truly a disappointment.  We waited 20 minutes for our sushi to be served and then received someone else's order. We waited for the order to be corrected. I ordered eel & sea urchin sushi. The eel was served cold and the sea urchin was old and slimy. We sat at a table near the bar & had a view of what appeared to be someone's closet. We saw coats on the floor and a tennis shoe protruding out into the restaurant. In addition, there was an industrial bucket sitting on the bar chair with lemons and limes and no cover. My first experience there was amazing. This experience of a dirty restaurant with poor quality sushi has left me with a bad taste in my mouth!

I'm a big fan of hibachi-style cooking, and my old place on the South Side was right down the street from Nakama, so I was excited to try it when I still lived there.  Once was enough, I'll never go back there again.  The food was pretty terrible through and through.  The meat didn't taste very fresh, the soup and salad were both forgettable, and the fried rice was AWFUL.  I can't understand why this place is so popular, my best guess is that some people consider it a "classy", "cultured" destination to get drunk at.  There are plenty of those types of places on the South Side already, and I'd venture a guess that even the bars serve better food.

fun restaurant, EXTREMELY rude people working there.  I would suggest confirming your reservation multiple times, at least 3.    ---BEGIN RANT---  I went here with a group of 10 people, we made the reservation a week in advance, and when we showed up on a Saturday night the place was PACKED, the wait for a table would be 2 hours, and our reservation was nowhere to be found.  Lost reservation was bad, but to top it off the hosts and hostess had MAJOR attitude insisting that we were lying about making a reservation, arguing with us for no reason, and generally making us feel very unwelcome.  Personally I don't enjoy being treated like crap when all I want to do is bring your restaurant lots of business.   Just because your restaraunt is decorated in a trendy way and serves sushi doesn't mean you aren't in Pittsburgh, so lose the NYC attitude Nakama!  ---END RANT---

If I had to describe Nakama in three words it would be "Overpriced, Loud, Boring". For a hibachi steak house, this place really doesn't seem to care about the whole, hibachi part. It basically is just watching someone cook food in front of you, there's no show, no flare, just a dude in a chefs hat frying your rice and leaving once you have your food. On top of that, for the price, the food is not even close to good enough to justify it, nor do you get enough of it. In all honesty if someone told me this place is only in business because of its location, I would believe them because the quality alone is not even close to enough to carry this place. I would not recommend going to this place, but I would recommend you check out Ichiban if you need your hibachi fix.

Once we got seated the chef came out after an hour wait. They charge extra for fried rice, and they didn't give you an option of noodles. You had to choose between shrimp or mushrooms. Usually those are both given to you free of charge. Other than that the food was pretty good.

The management is terrible!!!!! I ordered a seafood combination ( lobster scallops shrimp ) they give me tuna scallops and shrimp forget to bag my salad and soup!!!! On top of that the seafood combination cost 4-8$ more I called to address this the Chinese lady offered me a four dollar refund after they forgot my stuff an over charged me sad business practice I'm never going there again poor management

So it was payday and I decided to treat myself to some overpriced cocktails and sushi.  My wallet was bleeding a little bit after this night but it was worth it because you can observe cougars (literally in animal prints) hunt their prey. Dinner and a show!    OOO and not to mention there was a magician! YES, a magician at Nakama.  Hilarious. As far as magicians go, I guess he was good! It still kills me that Nakama and Max & Ermas have the same entertainment.   Service was a bit spotty. The place was packed but we still stay at the bar for 20 minutes sans cocktails.   Pro: Busy, Lively, good cocktail list, fresh sushi, good place to start the night  Cons: Slow service, pricey, strange amount of bachelorette parties (they has sashes and crowns)   Every once in awhile this place can be fun!

I was at Nakama yesterday and ordered the scallops hibatchi.  The rice and vegetables were fine but the scallops had a taste like an ammonia cleaning product.  Someone else in our party verified this.  I let the server know of the problem and was asked "would you like to speak with someone?"  I thought I was speaking with "someone" about it.  The waiter did nothing else and management did not come over.  I later googled "scallops taste like ammonia" and found that this is what scallops taste like when they are going bad because they produce an organic compound called an amine.  So, apparently Nakama served me old scallops, I complained about it, and then they didn't care.
Excellent spot for hibachi and sushi with friendy staff and quick service.  The Chicken Diablo dinner was delicious

I had the chicken and shrimp combination dinner.  The shrimp was good, the chicken was bland and chewy.  The service was good but the entertainment was pretty much nonexistent.  The real down side of this place was the price. The prices were way too high for such mediocre food.  There are more reasonable alternatives around that blow this place away.  I have been to so many of these Japanese steak house style places that I can tell when one is just average at best....and that was Nakama.

Found this place after the wait was too long at Fathead's down the street. It was crowded so we were offered a seat at the sushi bar and handed menu's but then found room at the regular bar and those menu's were higher priced! Ridiculous.  It was crowded and loud, why the dance music at sushi place?   The food was OK, the shrimp was a solid B, the strip steak was B+ but everything else was just average. The Japanese soup which is usually chicken based was mushroom based, yuck.  The small salad was trenched in too much dressing. The rice was decent, the sauce on the meals was just average. The check arrives with a higher price than the menu's. Turns out fried rice was $3.29 more than white, it would have been nice if the server told us ahead of time! Dinner and a Sapporo beer was $30 for one. Not a good value.

One of the coolest meals I have ever had. Watching a hibachi chef cook my food in front of me was a real treat. This place gets super crowded, so come early (or really late) and try making a reservation (although they will still probably make you wait). We had to wait a long time before they took our order and a lot more time after that before they started cooking our stuff before us, but once that starts, it all really becomes worth it. I am vegetarian so had miso soup, stir-fried mushrooms, vegetables and tofu with sticky rice (and sake!!).. it was all delicious... watching your food get made in front of you makes it soo much tastier. Portions are enormous, so don't overorder. Great place to catch up with friends and have a lot of fun.

I went to Nakama on Saturday for my birthday. I had a party of 9 and told the hostess my friend was in traffic and would be late. She insisted they could not seat us until everyone in my party arrived which to me seemed to inconvenience them more because we were occupying the lobby and seemed to be in the way. Once seated, it took long to get everything. A long wait to order drinks, then receive our drinks, then long to take our order. My reservation was for 8 and by 8:45 we hadn't even put our food order in. I ordered a margarita and 30min later I still hadn't received it so my friend complained to the manager who was walking around. He was very apologetic and explained our waitress was actually a hostess and he bought me the margarita. That definitely saved the night and I am thankful for his generosity. The food is good, your basic hibachi food. I didn't order sushi but my friends seemed to enjoy it.

This place has such a cool atmosphere and the food is great too. I love their sushi, it is incredibly tasty. I will definitely be making another trip here. It's also nice to sit outside and enjoy your meal when the weather is nice. Give this place a try, you won't be disappointed.

We decided to get dinner here with a group of friends here. We needed a reservation for all of us so we just sat at the bar and ate there. It was very packed during the dinner but the bar was empty.  Everyone ordered their own meal. I ordered shrimp fried rice and a sushi roll. It was plenty of food for me. I believe my roll had shrimp tempora, Avocado, cream cheese, and jalape√±o as well. There was good presentation and plenty of food for me.  The drinks were good and the bar crew was fun ! It was reasonably priced for what we got and being in the middle of the city. We were probably here for about 2 hours I think. We had a great time here that evening.

I've been to Nakama three times in the last four years, and I have to say I've had some mixed experiences from visit to visit. Nothing outright horrendous, but I've never had a perfect meal here, either.  During my first visit a family member and I sat by the window and enjoyed a quiet meal on a Saturday afternoon. My only complaint then was that there were no indications about just how big each order of sushi on the menu was; as a result we ended up putting in a second round of orders to fill up our stomachs, because round one was pretty light. (This problem still exists - they don't specify how many rolls you get next to every item or even in the section header. My orders have definitely ranged in size over the years and it's really hard for me to judge how big their rolls are without images or numbering. Special rolls in particular are rarely the same size as regular rolls since they have special ingredients.)  At dinner during my second visit I couldn't hear anyone in my dinner group over the grills, voices and music. The food was ok but the main thing I remember about the evening is leaving with a headache from the noise.   And my third and most recent visit, while mostly good, still wasn't quite spot on. On the plus side, presumably since it was a Monday evening it was relatively quiet and there was no loud or obnoxious music being blasted throughout the place. The chef making our dinner was very nice, he let his technique wow us and do most of the talking for him, and he occasionally engaged in polite conversation with us. I loved watching and listening to this gentleman and he was a huge improvement over the flirtatious comedic wannabe I dealt with at the last hibachi place I went to, which will remain nameless. The drink I ordered was delicious and based on the samplings I had from my family's meals, the hibachi orders were perfect - the meat was tender and juicy and everything was seasoned for flavoring and cooked just the way everyone wanted them. But like I said, the meal wasn't spot on. My sushi, the Hawaiian roll, was ok, although I wish there had been more tempura evenly distributed throughout it. Our waitress actually messed up part of my order - I got a plate of salmon roll instead of the salmon cake, but I had waited long enough for my food while watching my family's hibachi being made that I didn't feel like complaining about it and sending it back. (On that note, if you come as a group, know that hibachi and normal orders never arrive anywhere near the same time. Order appetizers if you don't want to sit at the table drooling as your friends or family's dinner cooks in front of you.)  I've definitely never had an outright bad experience at Nakama and the food has always been tasty enough, particularly the hibachi - but honestly I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here and it'll probably be another year or two before I stop by again. And while Nakama hasn't completely and utterly disappointed me, it just haven't "wowed" me yet, either.

Nakama might be a little pricy, but it's well worth the cost. I recommend incorporating the seared Ahi tuna into your selection. It melts in your mouth! The atmosphere is lively, but still conducive to conversation.  The Hanalei Roll, a tempura flash fried sushi roll, is my very favorite sushi roll.   The cocktails are tasty and extremely strong. The Slush Puppie Martini is my favorite!

I like the Hibachi experience, and I don't eat seafood. That being said, it is a little overpriced for the quality of the food. I have gone a few times. I like that they give veteran's a meal for free on veteran's day.
Just ok. It's the same hibachi you can get anywhere else except more expensive. My chicken was over cooked, and the shrimp was chewy. The fried rice is delicious, and so are the martinis.

Aside from the Southside ambiance and the bar, there is nothing more here to see than an overtly OVER-priced,  UNDER-quality Japanese fair.  Sushi "chef"s were laughable (being taught as they made my dishes... really? for a 30$ dish???), service was slow, having to remind the waitress over and over for even a glass of water... and the quality of the dishes mediocre.  Unless you are offering to spend at least double the amount worthy of the actual value of food and service, I would highly discourage anyone from visiting this establishment.  If you are looking for a classy, Japanese restaurant with a bar, I would go to UMI - SOBA on Ellesworth St. in Shadyside.

That Baked Alaskan roll though....what it does to my mouth, mmmmm  Nakama is smack dab in the middle of the action known as Carson Street. It's a good spot for dinner before going out or to celebrate something special, unless you're looking for someplace quiet.  The drinks here are delish and while the habichi is ok, the sushi is AMAZING. If habachi isn't your thing, you can opt for a table or sit at the bar. The servers and bartenders are very friendly adding to the overall experience.   Valet parking is offered on the weekends.  Finding a spot to park along the street during the week on the evenings is fairly easy.   Dine solo or with friends and Nakama has all the makings for a good time.

Jalepeno margarita was tasty but weaker than the faclcon's defense in the last quarter of the super bowl. Rolls were tasty but lacking in the filling and were limp...err soggy? I can't say anything about the hibachi as I sat closer to the bar area. This is a pass for sure.

Food was pretty good but prices were outrageous. Customer service is not good. First, they do not have a spicy salmon roll and if I wanted spicy salmon I had to get the sauce on the side for an extra 75 cents, did I mention we spent over 175$? come on! I felt I was nickle-dimed to death.  Then came the vegetables, none of the kids meals come with vegetables or noodles and their kids dinners are the same price (or more) than the other hibachi places in the area.   I had to pay extra 4 dollars for vegetables.  Come on we are in the burbs we feed our kids vegetables.  They need to work on their pricing and market research for their new location. Waiters need some help too they did not know the menu and could not provide much help making selections.  May try again in a few months but that was a lot of money for a not very good experience.

Good sushi and sashimi. Miso soup was just ok. The Uni was delicious. The row with quail eggs was lacking some flavor. It's medium all the way around not great not bad. I loved the Carson St atmosphere.
Our family's favorite Hibachi restaurant. Workers are wonderful. Luke is THE BEST!!! Amazing chef and Fantastic with kids!!!!! HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!!
Sushi is inconsistent. I've had bad sushi here several times. Habachi is very good, but on the pricier side

This used to be Miyako. I was devastated when I heard Nakama bought them out but learned that they have the same employees on staff. To be honest, I dislike the Nakama in the south side but love this location. This Nakama in Wexford is the only Hibachi restaurant in Pittsburgh I will go to. Their fried rice, shrimp sauce, everything is so delicious. It's better than the hibachi restaurant I visited in Kobe, Japan. I normally only get hibachi there.

I am currently at my table and just couldn't wait to rave about my experience here!!! We came during happy hour and had excellent deals on drinks and apps! We got an array of sushi as well, my favorite being the Crunchy Philly.. and that's coming from someone who isn't much of a sushi eater!
