Everyone was also very happy with their martinis and they have a wide range of selections to satisfy any craving! Our server, Marissa was so sweet and very attentive to us! Our drinks never went dry and she was more than excellent.   We all enjoyed our experience here immensely! Thanks Marissa!
Great sushi.  Very unique rolls and large portion size.  It can get really crowded on the weekend, so call ahead.

I set up a reservation through open table for a Sunday evening. I specified that it was my sons birthday when I reserved. Arrived at Nakama and made sure the hostess knew it was my sons birthday. She asked if I wanted the pineapple or ice cream. I told her the ice cream. After eating a very mediocre dinner (saga is much better and a more reasonable price) we received our check. No ice cream and no recognition of my son's birthday. The chef even asked us if we had any birthdays and we told him yes! My husband chases after the waitress explaining that it was my sons birthday (4th time they were told). She arrives with the gong and no ice cream. Seriously don't even make an effort to celebrate a birthday if we have to beg for it. I will NEVER come back. The bathroom was absolutely disgusting. Soap dispenser ripped off the wall, paper products all over the floor, mildew around faucet and a bathroom attendant standing outside greeting you as you walk in a bathroom that is far worse than a convenience store. This place has had it's run and is done. Absolutely disgusting! And I have never given a review on here before. I can't help but to feel compelled to do so!
Great place to eat!  Great Wine selection, had the 1997 Cake Bread Cabernet.  I would highly recommend this place if you want great food and great vibe.
Better than Bennihanna and Shogun. A little more expensive but less filler and more protein. The Filet & Shrimp combo was perfect. Our server Rae was prompt and very mindful. 4 1/2 stars

Honestly nothing special compared to other hibachi places. The most recent time I went I had to ask for a box twice, sat and waited for awhile when everyone else in my party left, still didn't receive the box after the waiter visited the table next to me two more times to suck up while delivering the checks, so finally got up and left. I probably won't be back - just not worth how average it is.

This used to be our favorite sushi & sashimi bar in Pittsburgh but it seems the quality & service are travelling down hill, or at least they were last night.  We went here for my birthday and were greeted by the hostess with a blank stare.  She didn't say anything...  Nothing...  So I said, 'Hi, we'd like a teppanyaki table', to which she responded with another blank stare.  Then I said 'Hibachi...' and she woke up and said, 'That'll be at least 15-20 minutes or so...' and then went back to her blank stare.  Nothing like, 'Would you like to grab seats at the bar? Start your meal off with a drink? How about a sushi roll while you wait...' nothing...  So I said, 'Ok, we'll wait...' and seated ourselves at the sushi bar.  It took at least 5 minutes for the actual waitress to appear and it seemed like it was a chore for her to get us a couple glasses of water.  She didn't offer any help picking out rolls or sushi so we were on our own.  We settled on a 'Steeler Roll' for $14.  Looking around at the closest hibachi table to us, I could see 6 people seated and 2 empty seats.  I figured they were waiting for someone- turned out they weren't.  I also assumed that maybe they had ordered already- they hadn't.  Had they ordered drinks already maybe- Nope...  It was obvious that the hostess just wanted to be ignorant and make us wait for another table.  Ok, fine.  She doesn't get tipped anyway.  So our roll arrives and we start in on it.  It tastes pretty good but the eel that we so love is being lost in the quantity of rice surrounding it.  It even had trouble staying together.  Then the hostess comes over and says 'Are you ready...?' to which I look at her, then at the roll, and say, 'We'll need a few minutes...'  On to the teppanyaki table...  The restaurant was super loud because I think there was an 'End of the Season Pittsburgh Steeler party' in the back room and they were making all kinds of commotion so I can't fault the waiter on how hard it was for all of us to hear him.  Oh, by the way- our table was only half full when they started service.  There was my wife & I and another couple.  Maybe they were trying to get us in & out quickly, I don't know...  Our waiter started to take our orders and I heard him offer the couple next to us, 'Would you like to upgrade your white rice for fried for an additional charge?' and they both said no.  Looking in the menu, I see that a side of fried rice without any purchase is $3.29 so when it came time for us to order, he offered the same thing and I asked him how much the 'upcharge' was.  $3.29 was his response.  Why wouldn't he just ask if we'd like an additional side of fried rice for $3.29 instead of making it sound like you were getting a better deal by declining the white rice in favor of fried for $3.29???  Stuff like this really bothers me so I told him, 'I would like fried rice but I also want the steamed rice I'm already paying for...' to which he says, 'Fine with me man, I don't care how much rice I bring out...'  Nice customer service...  Anyway, we ended up with the only American teppanyaki chef in the entire place, and he was just getting over bronchitis or something because he barely spoke and when he did, it was in a very low tone.  Don't get me wrong- he was a very nice guy...  My wife had ordered the Bob's Triple Combo (Strip steak, Chicken & Shrimp) and I ordered the Chef's Choice (Strip steak & Chicken).  They were both delicious and aside from the service issues, we had a very nice meal.    We both agreed though- next time we're going out for sushi- we're going to Sake at South Side Works.  The chefs are much friendlier, the fish is fresher and the prices are much more reasonable (Half price on Sunday's & Monday's)

I've had a lot is sushi in my life. Being thai and Laotian, I've eaten a lot of raw "protein" dishes. Sushi was Not fishy at all here. Pretty impressed with that. Fishy ness is not necessarily a bad thing (in asian cuisine that is) but when u can't even smell it here...it says something.
Nakama in Southside is great. Nakama Express in Greentree is not good. The staff there is disrespectful and lazy. I would not go back.

I love Nakama- have been going there every now and then for years. Sushi is great, hibachi is good as well. However, last night I decided to order a healthier version of my meal. I asked they could cook it without butter and with double vegetables, no rice.  (a simple request that most Hibachi restaurants are OK with). A few minutes after I ordered, the manager came out to ask me if I was allergic to butter- I said no just watching what I eat. He told me that if they busier, they would not be able to make my requested meal but if they were busy, they would not be able to make it. He wanted to make sure I knew in case I wanted to order again. While he was very nice about it, I found it troublesome that a restaurant that cooks everything fresh will not customize a meal while busy. Not a huge deal overall, but still would not come here if you are trying to be health-cautious.

I have to say, I was not super impressed by this place at all. I have been wanting to try Nakama since I moved to Pittsburgh in 2011, but I never got around to going. My overall impression is that this place is spectacularly average, and extremely overpriced. Dishes range from $30-$40 on average, unless you order the Kobe Steak dish, which is a whopping $70. Wow. I went on a Sunday night, so it was not crowded or loud as I'm sure it is on weekends, being in such a prime location on the south side. We were seated right away and our server was polite, friendly and fast. No problems there.   We got a sushi appetizer that was delicious and fresh, but it was pretty expensive for the quantity. I have had good sushi for cheaper, and this became the theme of the night: "it's good, but why is it so expensive?" I did not find, as other reviewers have said, that this was the best sushi in the city. It was very good. It was high quality, but it was not the best, and it was expensive.   I ordered the tuna steak hibachi, and my boyfriend ordered a spicy steak hibachi dish. Hibachi orders at this place include the typical salad and miso soup, as well as an appetizer of either mushrooms or shrimp. I will say that the miso soup was the best I have ever had a joint like this. It was flavorful and had more mushrooms than usual. The salad was typical. The shrimp appetizer consists of 3 small pieces of shrimp. While I greatly appreciated the extra snack, this addition does not really justify the price difference between this and other hibachi places.   Our chef was perfectly capable, but not fun or talkative at all. Maybe it's not considered classy or upscale, but I like to have fun when I go to a place like this, and I appreciate chefs who make jokes, get creative, and talk to us while they're cooking. Our chef made good food, but he barely talked at all, and didn't really do anything exciting. He did the onion tower, but that's about it.   The food was good, but nothing spectacular. My favorite thing was my boyfriend's spicy dish, because it came with these really delicious thick noodles. The spicy sauce is a creamy orange sauce that still has a lot of kick. It was delicious, actually. I wish I ordered that. The tuna steak was fine, but nothing to write home about.   Overall, my experience was perfectly fine at this place, but when I pay this much for a meal I expect more than just an acceptable experience. There are plenty of places in and around the city where you can get similar meals for much cheaper. I probably won't go here again.

Working on the Southside, I have been visiting Nakama 1-3 times per year since it opened. This place has definitely gone downhill. I probably would have given 4 stars when it first opened but not now. Food and service was not great at all. Probably won't go back unless I have to for some work-related function.

Owners have very bad attitudes and customer service skills. Waitress was lazy and didnt look like she wanted to be there. Our food was overcooked . I wouldn't recommend eating here when they're better Asian cuisine and other restaurants on East Carson.

Guess what - uni is in season!!!  And Nakama is one of the few places we were able to find it.  We came at a weird time (too late for lunch and too early for dinner) but we were just coming really for the uni so we sat at the sushi bar.  Sushi is fresh and amazing!!  I have been craving sushi for the past few weeks and Nakama served up exactly what I wanted.  Our server was great - food delicious - wine was refreshing.  Everything was perfect - so left very happy and will be back

My friend suggested me to come here for sushi and I was not impressed at all. They're sushi was very mediocre and it did not taste anything special just like a regular sushi roll that you can get from a grocery shop
We came in, sat at the bar and proceeded to have a delightful time filled with delicious sushi rolls and nigiri. Definitely would recommend.

We were there for lunch today and it was ok.  We probably won't go there again though.  The food was average.  The cleanliness was below average.  We ate at the hibachi table and even though there were 8 seats at the table, the hostess sat my hubby and I right up next to the only other couple at the table.  I assumed she was planning on filling up the whole table but once that didn't happen, I felt rude to move.  No big deal really.  They brought out water, soup, and salad and I heard the guy at our table say there was a hair sticking out of his water glass.  The cooktop had plenty of small pieces of food from the people before us but I figured the chef would clean it better before he cooked.  Well, he did wipe the very center but the old food remained.  I really tried to not watch after that.  The food was average.  We didn't have chopsticks at our table which was disappointing.  I'm sure they had them somewhere and I didn't ask so that's my own fault.  I just expect them to be on the table at Japanese restaurants.  Lunch prices were good.  Ill probably stick to my favorites though...Pho Van in the Strip and Mekong in Dormont.

Cherry blossom sushi roll. Need I say anymore?! Well besides the edamame with Siracha and miso soup.. I just can't get enough sushi from the place. I have no complaints about the hibachi but I find myself at nakama strictly for my cherry blossom roll. Mmm. Sushi. Oh and sake bombs. God bless the sake bombs...

Have been here a few times when in town for work.  The place is a bit of meat market at times, but very entertaining.  It reminds me a lot of Ra Sushi.  I have only had the sushi and rolls, but the portions are enormous.  The quality is decent as well.  Drinks are okay, but I would skip any of the specialty cocktails.  Go with the sake bombs (sapporo and saki).  Late night is fun, as this is a place to be seen.

Quality of edible product: not good Quality of service: not good Environment: very loud in front room, dead fish in bowl behind sushi bar  I would never eat here again unless they were taken over by new ownership.  And then they would get one chance.

This place was so delicious. I was nervous because it only had three stars but man was I in for a surprise. Great food, clean atmosphere, and very nice bartender! So happy my wife and I gave it a chance!

Seated our large group within minutes even though we didn't have a reservation, food was hot and delicious, they actually had vegan choices for their specialty rolls! Hibachi chef was a gentleman and did a good performance and was a great cook. Service was fast and polite. The magic tricks in the lobby while we waited was a plus :) Would recommend!
Best hibachi in Pittsburgh! The quality of the lobster and steak were melt in your mouth. Plus cooked to perfection! Very accommodating with gluten allergy.

OK so June 17,2016 I went on a date with my girlfriend.  She chose this restaurant she never been there before.  So we get there and we have my vehicle valet parking.  We eat then we get the check not only did the server try to over charge for my meal heal sat in my face and told me that I asked for my meal to be separately rang up.  Why would I do that an it would cost more?  But any who then we go out to get my vehicle and it takes about ten minutes for him to come back with it. Now today I get a parking ticket in the mail talking about a parking violation!  But how I ask?  I don't know but guess who won't be eating here ever again.

I am going to give this place a bump in its reviews because I feel as though it's deserving. We came here on a Sunday night and we're greeted promptly. We sat near the Carson street side windows (great for people watching).   Our server was very friendly and had suggestions for us when we asked. He was quick and didn't miss a thing on our order. I noticed the busser was working extremely hard as well! Every-time we finished a dish they were walking by to grab it which was nice.   Sushi was good. They could improve on the quality and portions but overall pretty good. Make your own opinions but I would take the bad reviews with a grain of salt. I find most people usually only review when upset... food for thought. I had a good experience and will be back.

Never coming back :( I've given this place so many chances. I remember years ago when the sushi and service was great, now the only good thing about it here is there hot food. If you go here, they have very tasty lunch entrees, that's it, and be ready for iffy service. I went last week and sat at the bar in clear view of the bartender who was too busy playing on his phone to greet me. I got a sashimi platter and boston roll. I ate two pieces of sashimi, the second bite I had to spit into a napkin, I couldn't bring myself to swallow it. The boston roll was okay, but not very cool. Even the sashimi was above room temp and very fishy and just bad. I'm a service industry employee myself, you have to be pretty shitty for me to give a bad review....it was that bad, sorry bout it :(

As far as the sushi goes, I'll have to pass from here on out. I can never understand why this place is so packed as it is when I pass it sometimes. Oh, I know why. Because people are clueless. Yes, that's it. (And it has a good location.)
Delicious sushi rolls in a chic atmosphere! Very fresh ingredients and creative combinations. Reasonably priced drinks, too. Definitely a good local pick.

I went there with my son because he really wanted to go.  He loves sushi and is always excited about flying food, so what better place to go, right?  And it's always packed, which means it must be good, right?   Overall I'd say wrong.  The sushi was about the same quality that I get at Giant Eagle.  You know the kind... "I'm really jonesin for some sushi, but I guess I'll take the old salmon stuck on top of crunchy cold rice because I'm too lazy to put my ass in the car and drive to Sushi Kim or some other real sushi bar."  The hibachi: Quality level on par with Benihana.  Enough said.  It reminds me of what a chef friend of mine said about the Spaghetti warehouse one day: "Fancy Ragu".  The hibachi was fancy canned chop suey.  Oh, and the price.  One adult and one 14 year old lunch (2 small plates of sushi and 2 hibachi lunches) $80.00.  Someone hand me the Astroglide.  Quick.  I've been sampling these kinds of establishments on both coasts for the past 15 years, from Vancouver BC to San Diego, from Miami to Boston.  For what they charge, the quality should be much better and the staff should TRY to smile once in a while.  Sorry, honey, but tight skirt and 17 layers of makeup can't hide a mean heart.  Here ends the rant prescribed by this reviewer for this restaurant.

I was skeptical about coming here after reading all of the awful reviews, but have to say that I was pleasantly surprised by the food once I got there. I had the standard sesame chicken hibachi dinner and everything I ate was excellent - the ginger salad dressing was really tasty, onion soup was just OK, and all of my hibachi food - shrimp appetizer, chicken, veggies and fried rice was really very good. Everything was very flavorful without being overly salty.   Our server was attentive and friendly, even when we had an issue with a watery mojito that one of my friends ordered, she rectified the situation immediately and gave her another drink without hesitation.   While the food and service was good here I just cant get over how stupidly expensive this place is. I wouldn't even think about getting sushi here at their prices - 15.00 for a dragon roll? Come on! Even the hibachi dinners are over priced. I won't be making frequent trips here just simply due to price. 33.00 for ONE person for ONE dinner and a beer? Just a little too steep for me.

Read previous reviews and people seems like love or hate this place. But we still decide to give it a try just because of it is located in the heart of southside and it would against logic that it serves the worst sushi. It was a Sunday night and we were able to grab a seat very quickly. We ordered seaweed salad, tuna poke, Unami sashimi, rainbow roll and Hawaii style roll. I have to say I am glad we gave this place a chance. The seaweed salad could be better but it certainly didn't taste bad tho. Just compare to everything else it was just average. But of course Everything else tasted great! The reason I am giving it a four star not five are service and sanitary.   Service, the waitress refilled my water once and then just didn't think I might need another refill. Drank the last drop of my water, not happy with this. Sanitary, saw a huge fly on the window(thank god not on our table or even food). I'm guessing it might just got in since the door was open and we sat at the high table area which is kind close to the door.  So over all, some miner change will put this place to a five star sushi place.

My second time to Nakama left a lasting impression enough for me not to ever come back. I ordered the shrimp and chicken during the lunch hour and it wasn't good. I couldn't even finish, or get all of the side dishes. I was gonna take it home for the dogs but they wouldn't have eaten it either. I had a friend pay for me but I felt so bad she wasted her money on that shitty meal. Also, take a look at the cleanliness. Or lack there of. A lot of work needs to be done or just shut it down altogether!!

Nakama tries to be very trendy, but I have experienced much better sushi for a better price.  Still, the sushi is better than many people claim.  I had very good service here.  And there is some great people watching.  But we have much better choices for Japanese food in Pittsburgh.

everybody knows this place and it's an upscale destination for a night out.  whether hibachi, sushi, or bar crowd, you're bound to find what you came for.  is it the best sushi in the world?  nah, good but overrated.  but.... that's not really the sale here.  the sale is the atmosphere and in that sense, it usually delivers.

So I was recently in town as part of that annual convention involving tails and ears (If you're from Pittsburgh I'm sure you know what I'm talking about!)  Anyways, my friends and I decided to give this place a go on the last night as a final hurrah. Folks who had been dealing for the convention were running late getting their trucks packed up so we didn't even get to the restaurant until after 9:30 PM.  We called and asked if they would still do the hibachi grill for our party and they were very welcoming of us and said sure, absolutely! So despite getting there so late we all got treated to a fabulous meal and a fun show, we're all thankful not just to Nakama but to the whole city of Pittsburgh for welcoming us to their city every year!  On to the food, I tried their Diablo Seafood hibachi which was shrimp and scallops cooked up with udon noodles in a spicy sauce. It was very unique from the other hibachi meals due to the noodles and spicy sauce so my order had to be cooked last but it was more than worth it. Everything was delicious, the spicy sauce actually makes you sweat a little bit but certainly is not over powering. My girlfriend had some hibachi steak and, well, any time you got a beautiful cut of meat cooked up right in front of you like that you just know it's going to melt in your mouth.  Everything was great, we're already talking about coming back to Nakama next year, hopefully at a much earlier time in the day though. Thanks again!
Manager refused to take a coupon, said that there is nowhere to accept it through the register. Pretty sad to be honest. Will not return.

This is my absolute favorite hibachi place. I have never had a bad experience here and I've been eating here for years. I'm always confident I'll have great food and great service.  I have been to several hibachi restaurants, Nakama has he BEST food by far, as well as the best service.

I like Nakama, but you need to be ready for more of a bar / party type experience.  The hibachi is good.  The food is good.  It really comes down to the chefs.  They have a couple chefs that put on a crazy good show.  If you get one of them, you are in luck.  They each seem to have their quirks.  It isn't the typical show of a little bit of flame and a shrimp tail in the hat.  The sushi bar and regular bar are where Nakama really shines.  Nakama has a great bar scene and good sushi.  The sushi isn't the best in the city, but it is well done.  The fish to rice ratio is great and they have a diverse selection of pretty sushi rolls for people who want to go beyond your standard single fish product and rice.  I'd strongly recommend Nakama if you want some good sushi and drinks in a upscale busy bar environment.  If you are looking for an 'authentic' sushi / hibachi experience, this is not the place.  Nakama fits the Southside scene.  You hit Nakama before a club or party bar.

Food here has finally gotten to the level of the service. Fish used in the Sushi is of low quality and is no longer worthy of eating. Service at the bar in the daytime is very lacking.   The bartenders act like they are doing you a favor by waiting on you. Oh almost forgot to mention... The still have Oktoberfest beer on tap in mid December. The beer is from August. Throw it away and put a Xmas beer there. Or wait till may to do that...  Another case of the owners just milking the gravy of what they built. Can't blame them I guess. Place was really good 8 years ago when it had to be.  Update... 1/1/16  Had to meet a client there today. Black curly haired bartender acted like she was doing us a favor by giving us a menu.   SHE WAS RUDE AND IGNORANT!!! For zero reason. Just plain mean. If she is not an owner or related to them then she must have pictures of the owner in a compromising position. Otherwise who would want her in a service industry position.   She gave me a menu that looked like it was out in the rain for 3 days. Was really ignorant about it too. I just suggested we go somewhere much more worthy of our money so we left. But not before I apologized to her for being a bother by simply sitting down at the bar she was working.   Although I work on the south side and love sushi, I will never go back into this place. Zero management I guess. Sad...

Anyone with a brain will instantly recognize that this place is not about the food AT ALL. It's about its function on the South Side; the Dream House for all the Ken and Barbie types. You will find Pittsburgh guido / yinzer OAFS eagerly paying through the hose for over-priced meat in hopes of wooing one of the many ex-sorority, Louis Vuitton bag hag bar WENCHES. For the poor OAFS who slobber over these WENCHES with their wallets, this watering hole is their surest spot to buy tuna. As for the WENCHES; it is the perfect place to parade the whitest teeth, highest heels, and blondest roots. This restaurant is the pole-dancing embodiment of what your average black and gold bleedin' yinzer believes to be upscale. Case in point, a hand-soap-offering attendant in the men's restroom; truly ridiculous........... just smacks of a naive pretentiousness that only the provincial mind-set of a South Side bar-barian would find 'classy'. I guess I'm not one for 'classy' restaurants anyway; they are always way too tacky.

While the food was OKAY - I would say I prefer the taste and overall experience of Saga better..   The waiter forgot to cook one of the kids meal - so the 9yo had to sit and wait for her food while the rest of the table ate  The kids menu should truly be a kids menu - you can't give a 6yo and 9yo the same portion as the adults!    The meals were over priced and certainly more salty than any other hibatchi place I've been to.  With all that being said I will likely not return to this restaurant.

We sat at the bar on a pretty slow Saturday night for dinner and it doesn't have the same feel as the south side location.  The older bartender with long brown hair never cracked a smile or acknowledged us- she had a general harsh persona about her and made us feel unwelcome. Another diner that was sitting at a table behind us asked her for a refill on his water and she rudely told him that he would have to wait for his server to get him water. Finally, a friendly, younger blonde bartender took our drink and dinner orders.  She was very nice and attentive and was happy to have a tab since the other staff members were complaining, rather loudly, about how slow it's been for them- and I guess that equates to lack of tips. I don't need to hear that while I'm out out trying to enjoy my evening out with my husband.  The food was good but the general atmosphere of the bar area was just uninviting. The prices are a bit overinflated for their sushi compared to other places in the area.  I think Ichiban has a much better atmosphere and better service.

I could live off of their spicy steak diablo.....truly something that sets them above and beyond all other hibachi restaurants!!!! The decor is great and the food is amazing. Like I said, better than all other hibachi. It's hard to mess hibachi up in my opinion, but Nakama is so good it makes every other place I've tried seem mediocre. The steak is always cooked to perfect as per how you request, the service is always fast, friendly, and entertaining, even when they're packed busy. The sushi is soooo fresh and again, some of the best that I've had. They honor their reservations well also, and we've never had a problem with having to wait or a scheduling error. They really do what they do very very well.
Total bad experience..Rude waitress + average food. Sharing food is a strict no. Walked out of there as soon as possible.

I have read all the negative reviews but I can't offer one. I really enjoyed our last visit. We made a reservation on open table for a Sunday afternoon. We were the first ones through the door. We have only been to the South Side Location.  The restaurant was clean and ready for the day. The staff was friendly and accommodating to our special occasion. It was a Birthday celebration.   I really enjoyed the Hibachi and Loved the sushi. I always order chicken or salmon Hibachi and I try to always get a Philadelphia Inside out roll.  Everything was fresh and prepared to our liking. Hibachi is always great, because you can see what is being made right in front of you.  I am looking forward to finding the food truck!     We received a free appetizer that day, go on the website and give them a little information and they will send you a email for a free appetizer.  Highly recommend for Hibachi Lovers like myself.

Today was my first experience at Nakama. I walked in with a group of 30 - 35 people and asked to be sat at the sushi bar. I was disappointed with the hostess when she told me  the sushi bar does not have that many seats. I suspected she was lying to me because at least two of the members of my group were black. So i asked if they could accommodate two, me and my piece. They happily said yes and informed us it was all self seating. I was genuinely surprised by the lack of Asian servers. Most of the servers were white. When the server came of i snidely requested a glass of their most expensive champagne, only to throw a hissy fit when I found out the brand was not one I enjoyed. I honestly had no idea of the names this was all in an attempt to seem pretentious and impress my piece I was with. After I got done humiliating the server I asked her for "just a water, with extra lemons on the side". I also asked for some obscure sweetener I knew they did not have. I rolled my eyes and said sweet n low will do. The sushi menu was archaic. There were no pictures of anything. It didn't help that the sushi bar has all the raw  fish and everything they use in their rolls in a glass case right in front of you at the bar. I was very upset when i couldn't find totinos pizza rolls on the menu, so I went with a crunchy Philly roll. I had no idea what to expect because as I said, there were no pictures. The sushi chef handed me my food directly as to intimidate me. I took it without flinching. The ho i was with seemed very pleased with her order. I on the other hand immediately told the server that wasn't what I ordered. I asked her what was in it and she began to list the ingredients, including uncooked salmon. I then began listing a number of diseases and sickness' you can obtain from eating raw sea food. I demanded she take it back and just get me a side of fries. Go figure, they didn't have french fries. So I ordered a well done filet and asked for ketchup, which they also didn't have. I explained to her that the Heinz ketchup factory was right across the bridge I was completely baffles as to how they did not have ketchup. Nevertheless, my steak was quite good and my partner enjoyed her meal so much that I scored so hard later that night, after 4 hours of heavy drinking followed by 10 minutes of me insisting to my piece I was fine to drive home. Overall Nakama was a great experience and I tipped my server $40,000.

The events that took place yesterday afternoon at Nakama leave me ultimatley confused and extremely saddened. I no longer live in Pittsburgh, but it is still the place I consider home. What do you do when you come home to visit? You visit loved ones, celebrate birthdays, weddings, graduations, and you eat all of your favorite spots! I joked with friends, "I CAN'T WAIT TO GO TO NAKAMA"! Well never shall I step foot in that place again. I have celebrated birthdays, friends birthdays, celebrations, heck my family even took my GRANDMA there for her 91st birthday this past December! I've have birthday celebrations there with over 50 people! Long story short over the course of goodness 5+ years I have been a patron of Nakama. For Pittsburgh, this once was a place that was sort of a staple for the community. You take your friends from out of town there...It was simply thee place to meet a friend for a quick drink and appetizer, or for me a sports girl, even dine at the window and watch a game or two...NOT ANYMORE! Frankly once management changed and the playing cards came off the ceiling the service and FOOD was never the same! I'm not making this up, but I have seriously gotten sick several times, yet my simple behind would still go back because "its Nakama", "it's my FAV"! Even yesterday before we left SkyBar a friend reminded me, "Girl last time you went there before you moved to NYC, you got sick!" I was like OMG, you're right! Yet me and 7 other friends happily marched down to Nakama because we wanted to do an impromptu following of tradition a CELEBRATE A BIRTHDAY, quickly at the bar. We sat down ordered food and drinks, everything was fine... A manager comes over and says to my friend whose birthday it was... (of course he ruined her bday) you need to cover up we have a strict dress code. Now mind you my friend next to me had the same sheer sleeveless version over her bikini...My friend who the manager chose to point out, her cover up was long sleeve, floor length.. and she had on shorts. Why he chose to single out one girl and not the other puzzling if you catch my drift. Mind you..... our other friend had another cover up on who in my opinion was more scandalous than both of those put together! Anywho, we say okay, cool, she holds her cover closed and he walks away. By this time all drink and dinner orders had been placed and we saw another friend who thought we were still at SkyBar walk past the Nakama window, so my friend who had just been yelled at runs out to get her. Our friend who was just arriving has on a bikini top but BEFORE WALKING INTO NAKAMA SHE PUTS ON A SHIRT! My birthday friend comes in and sits down and the manager storms back over and begins yelling. He said something like I told you, you cant wear that in here and you will be asked to leave... Some people's food had actually begin to come out, so they are like huh?! We are eating?! He gets louder and louder... we were like look... she has buttons it's buttoned... Mind you we are at the bar...Seated! No one can really even tell what the heck you have on! We weren't in the dining room we were at the bar! And to top it off, it wasn't even busy! Other patrons were watching and making comments, after the discussion with the manager escalated because he was NOT being reasonable -he then told us to get out!? WHAT?!HUH?! I guess the customer isn't always right... They just lost hundreds of dollars over a bathing suit cover up (see picture) Other patrons were disgusted actually telling us sorry, that was rude and disgusting. I woke up this morning to a long post from a women saying how what she witnessed how it was degrading and uncalled for. Here's the best part my friend sat there to finish her water and the manager called the police! The Pittsburgh Police !They spoke2 the manager inside and then came out to speak to us and frankly, the cops thought it was a joke also. They said they aren't they dress code police they are the real police. This manager took time out of the cops day when they could have actually been needed elsewhere to whine about some swimsuit coverups! What a joke. I miss the old Nakama not this stuck up, stuffy one, with lying managers and clearly some personal problem with race... He clearly singled out my black friend and said nothing to my white friend and for what?!Why?! We were just coming there to do what we always do year after year celebrate a birthday! I had a flight back to NYC that night but I was willing to risk missing my flight just to eat a little bit of Nakama. Due to a flight change I ended up not even having time to eat because I missed my dinner opportunity due to an incompetent managers stupidity. Dear Nakama, my old friend who is fake and clearly has changed, you won't get another cent from me and all of my family and friends! Just how a random strangers post was able to make it to me on Facebook only hours later, she won't be returning nor will her friends! PGH is small so we will all continue to talk!

Pricey and overrated. Food isn't bad but not anything special..I've had better at Benihana. Sushi is pretty good. The people who cook in front of you are always pretty friendly though which definitely improves the overall experience.

When they first opened the food was great. We would go at least once a month. In the last year or two the quality has gone down. The portions have gone down and the $$ has gone up. Also the consistency in the food has dropped.  Used to be our favorite place, now it doesn't come up when we talk about going to eat.

My girlfriend and I decided to go to Nakama yesterday for some hibachi lunch. I have been here many times before, but this is the first I will write about it. We were seated immediately at one of the tables. There was a group of 5 already seated at the table we were seated at with their drinks already in hand and ready to order. We felt a bit rushed because they were ready to order and we just sat down. My girlfriend ordered the Spicy California Roll as an app. She said it was "ok".... Nothing special. ... But in their defense she also said it's a pretty plain roll. I got the Bobs Triple Combination with steak, shrimp, and chicken, while she got the Hibachi Shrimp. After she was eating the roll, the server came over and said "so, is the roll repulsive?!". To which my girlfriend responded "yeah, it's disgusting". It was just completely awkward. He didn't know if she was serious.. I did, and gave him the ok nod. It was just weird. I had some captain and cokes, she had a few Rieslings... The cook was great, the food was tasty as always. I do think he put a but too much salt in it, but it was still great. Our tab after tip was $121.00   All in all, an ok experience. If it wasn't for the awkward comment from the waiter, it would have been a 4 star.. I do love me Hibachi and it's the closest place to me, so I am sure I will be back. I do prefer Sapporo out on 60 because it is a family run business and you are always treated greatly...

I think my bartender was having a bad day.  I have been to Nakama a few times.   I usually meet to discuss business.   This was my least favorite experience at Nakama.    The food was pretty good.     I just cannot get over the service.  The bartender was short and gave the impression we were putting her out when she took our order.   I agree with some other reviews where the place is not the same when I originally moved here.    I will get my hibachi / sushi fix elsewhere.   There are plenty of options on Carson.  What a shame :-(

We flew into Pittsburgh for two days for a penguins playoff game...I don't know why this place has three stars...we were in Pittsburgh for two nights and ended up here for dinner after bar hopping all day.  We got some appetizers and I had teriyaki chicken skewers and chicken with rice.  Drinks were extra strong, but not too much to the point of not being drinkable, just generously poured.   We had a great time here and would absolutely return on our next trip.

We ordered three different sushis and found them all lackluster. I think the main problem was the rice--rubbery and not enough vinegar. The service was nothing to rave about, although the rolls did come out fast.  For the price, I would rather go elsewhere to get better sushi.

I have eaten here many times and have found it enjoyable every time.  I must say I have only had the sushi, so I can't comment on the hibachi.  I am surprised on all the negative and mixed reviews on here.  I have eaten a lot of sushi, in a lot of restaurants, in a lot of cities and Nakama's is legit.    The prices are very fair especially for the portions and how fresh it is...the nigiri slices and sashimi pieces are generous and so are all the rolls....nigiri (2 pieces) or sashimi (3 pieces) of white tuna, ahi tuna, yellow tail, eel for 5.99, salmon 4.99.....inside out rolls (8 pieces) 5.99-6.99...maki rolls (6 pieces) for 3.99-4.99....rainbow roll and specialty rolls around 11.99....this is hardly pricey considering how much you get, how fresh it is and where you're eating it at....I don't see how people had bad times here...did I just get lucky and show up on their good nights everytime?  The sushi is well presented and the service has always been good.  The location is perfect in the heart of the south side.  It's a sexy, busy atmosphere and can get loud, but it's not a big deal, sit by the window for great people watching up and down Carson St.  If you sit at the bar, you'll find it comfy and easy to eat even though it is a small place....this isn't the biggest restaurant but it's set up nicely no matter where you sit....The drinks are good too!  It's a great spot to take a date or with friends....It's the place to be feel and has a good, energetic vibe.  It's a fun, good-looking, classy crowd and I have to give it 5 stars.  Everytime I go to Nakama it's been a great sushi and dining experience all around....
I love sushi. Nakama is far from my favorite, but the service was very good and the sushi is good. I'd go back if we're in the area, but I wouldn't go out of my way for it.

Overpriced Low-Grade Sushi  The sushi at this place sucks and is extremely overpriced.  I have tried at least 10 different rolls on their menu through out the times that I have been there.  The sushi is poorly rolled and falls apart. The fish and ingredients that they use are not fresh. The service is OK.  The hibachi is also overpriced as well. The chefs are similar to what you will get any hibachi place.  Also, if you sit in the bar area be prepared to deal with a bunch of yinzer wanna be NYC trendies listening to techno bumping into you while you are trying to eat your food.   The only reason this place stays in business is due to the trendy bar scene and the lack of sushi places in the Pittsburgh area.  However, I think if a restaurant/bar similar to nobu, sushi samba, or RA sushi opened up in Pittsburgh it would blow this place out of the water.
My husband and I just want to give this place a try, food is ok but over priced. The chicken lunch dish have no test, the dragon roll was ok. Anyway, the food are not worth the price we paid.

Quick, pick another place to eat! We had a terrible first and last experience here today...   Popped in for a quick lunch before we went shopping and from the moment we walked in the red flags went up but sense it was the only place to eat in the strip mall we were at we gave it a try...  Enter restaurant and there was a Hostess seated behind a podium who looked briefly up from her phone to ask us if we wanted table or grill seating, we said table and she said "just seat yourself in the bar" and promptly went back to whatever was important on her phone... Silly me, I always thought that "your job" took precedence over your phone...  Enter bar area and sat at what appeared to be a bussed and set table... Wrong again, kind of... the table was set but you could see where the last drinks and plates were from the previous customers or many previous customers...  Waitress arrives promptly with part of the menu, didn't point out the full menu was under the napkin. Asked us if we wanted drinks and with only 20 seconds at the table we asked for a few minutes... she smiled at us and took off... about 10 minutes goes by and I had to snag her as she was flying by to, well your guess is as good as mine since there was nothing behind us... The place was NOT busy, at all... at lunch... red flags again...  My wife asked a couple of clarifying questions on her choices and the waitress really had no idea how to answer them, but they were hard questions like "how large is the portion size?" and "what's the difference between the appetizer and main dish with the same name?", those sure would have stumped me if I worked there...  Wife's salad shows up, part of the "difference" was the main dish came with a salad and fried rice... I ordered a California Crab Roll and didn't expect it until the wife's main course showed up... Wrong again, her cooked meal showed up 5 minutes early to the party and I assumed maybe mine was taking longer due to the complexity of assembling a Japanese style roll, in a Japanese restaurant... Wrong again, the roll was pre-made and I don't think it was actually done at the restaurant, more like from a vendor, or vending machine... But it was served graciously as the waitress literally tossed it on the table as she walked by not missing a step. Had to run her down again to get a small wasabi dish for mixing the soy and radish...  Okay, so we've thoroughly established the service is way below any reasonable expectations, actually, the service was below any expectations, even the half asleep guy at the convenience store around 3am provides better service... so on to the food, this will be short and to the point... Bland, tasteless, over priced if it were free, and as I write this I'm currently counting my blessings I'm not writing this on the toilet... Only ate two of the 8 pieces and didn't want to push my luck.  I really hate writing negative reviews but felt the need as a "public service announcement". There are many great places in the area this place just wasn't one of them.
Love the food, and had great service, but the interior needs an update. Also, my beer was warm.

Not a fan of this place at all. I thought the food was O.K. and the service was horrible. We sat all the way in the corner behind the bar..it was so loud, service took forever, she didn't bring lemons with my water after I specifically asked for them, which I can't stand..why do they do that? What is so hard about bringing me a lemon with my water? They only offer white rice with their sushi which to me, kills the entire experience. The tofu in the miso soup was hard..we didn't even eat it. I thought this place was awful. Awful! On a side note, the salmon was $6 for 2 pieces of sushi. Really? Did the person running this restaurant think that there was a salmon shortage, that it was a rare species? Who do they think they are charging that much? Is it salmon laced with koala? BC THEN you could possibly charge $6 for it and that would make sense.

I know how many people seem to rave about Nakama... I really do not understand it.  As a young professional, I am offended at the lack of cheese and desperation in this place on any given weekend.  Is anyone themselves anymore?  Are people that desperate to keep up fake appearances and be someone that they are not?  That is the vibe that I get in this place.  Sorry to those who love it, but I know for certain I am not the only one who feels this way.  Sushi here is mediocre at best... I have had way better elsewhere (and I cannot believe I am going to say this- even Cleveland had many way better sushi options that Pittsburgh!- I love this city but we are lacking in options!).  If you sit at the bar or sushi bar, you will leave smelling like a Hibachi as well (wish there was something that they could do about this- if people want to stink, they would sit at the Hibachi tables I am sure).  Service is meh... I have had one great server the many times I have been there (I was forced to have work dinners there based on customer demands way too often, and one of my friends loves this place for a quick dinner so I have been here a lot).  I recommend a martini here... they at least are good.  Other drinks have seemed pretty weak.    I wish I could say better things being a resident of the Southside who prefers to stay local on weekends, but I cannot.

So a group of us decided to go to Nakama for dinner and my birthday. I don't know about them but my experience was not that impressive. I'm probably going to go ahead and split this up into sections.  Hostess: Before we arrived we had called to see if they had availability for 6 guests. Luckily for us they did. When we arrived we ultimately ended up sitting at the bar and I went back to let the hostess know that we didn't need the table anymore. Most hostesses I know would be more than happy to move onto the next guests waiting for a table but this hostess made sure we were ok and double checked if we really wanted to give up our table. I appreciated the gesture.  Cocktail Server: Since we decided to eat in the bar we grabbed a high top table along the window. Unfortunately this table only fit 2 guests at a time while one guests stood. We decided to make due whilst we waited for 6 seats to open up at the bar. The cocktail server made her way over to the table and we ordered soups and salads and a few plates of sushi. Service wasn't too bad with her and I can honestly say she did a great job considering how busy she was.  Bartender (Asian Guy) Before we ordered food from our server we tried to get the attention of the bartender. His attitude was pretty shitty for the most part. He honestly acted like he didn't really give a shit. And for me I take notice of everything  Since happy hour had not ended we wanted to take advantage of the $5 martinis. I ordered a Mango Tango which tasted more like fruit punch and vodka. I was a less than impressed plus he charged me the full price of 9 or 10 bucks. Learn your happy hour deals dude!   After the "martini" we decided to order a bottle of champagne from d check this I'm pretty sure we were the only ones in the entire establishment to order champagne.and honly had 1 champagne flute for a group of 6. One champagne flute and 5 water glasses. Are you for real? This is the epitome of ghetto. Working in the industry if you need 6 flutes you better pull 6 flutes out of your ass.   Bartender (Mark) made nakama worth going back to for his company and that's it

My mom has a visual disability and was dining at Nakama. She was having a difficult time seeing in the restaurant, and then the chef lit the grill on fire in front of her, which startled her into spilling soup all over herself and the floor. It's pretty standard customer service to provide assistance in cleaning up spills, but nobody from Nakama offered to help with cleanup. When they're charging $69.99 for a strip steak, there's no excuse for the incredibly poor customer service that my mom experienced.

My favorite hibachi place in Pittsburgh!  Nakama combines a great experience and atmosphere with delicious food and drinks.  I have never had a bad experience here.  The salad and mushroom soup they start you off with is better than any similar types I've had at other hibachi restaurants.  I love the ginger salad dressing and the great taste of the soup.  It is a great start to a great meal.  My go to meal here is the Hibachi Chateaubrind.  It is filet seared in a garlic butter.  I order mine medium rare and it is always cooked perfectly.  Each bite literally melts in your mouth and the flavor is out of this world.  The shrimp are also a delicious side to the meal.  I also find the rice at Nakama to just taste a little better than other spots.  Always look forward to my next trip back!
I've never had a bad experience here. The staff is great and so is the food. I usually go with the Yakitori (teriyaki chicken skewered) for a good lunch. Hibachi and sushi are great too.
The sushi and hibachi are really good! I've been here a couple times and it's a nice place to have good food and some drinks

They would get 5 stars because the food was good but the service was super slow. It was a Friday night and we had 3 different servers?? Two of them took our orders twice.. We had reservations at 8:00 and are just leaving now at 11:00. That's how slow. But the hibachi guy was awesome and the staff was friendly, just unorganized and incredibly snail-paced getting food out and filling water.   We went here for a friend's birthday. It was a surprise, but their policy is no seating until the entire party is there so we awkwardly had to surprise my friend sitting in separate groups at the bar lol

I love to eat here during the day, but never on crowded nights or weekends when you don't get any service. The stars are for the sushi chefs of course and their attention to their customers. The waiters still suck.
My experience today at nakama today was amazing !! The bartender Jordan..  She was so attentive to the WHOLE bar while making everyone feel comfortable.    Such a wonderful place!?

I was there with a party of 20 ppl (or so)and I can say,This is definitely the best sushi I've ever had!i really loved their apettizers too!prices are a bit higher than the rest of the hibachi places in the Pittsburgh but the quality of the meat and shrimp is upstanding so you get what you paid for!all of us were really pleased with all the selection we got!my favorite rolls were bake Alaskan(bit spicy),crunchy philly and lobster tempura!i would say that if you're cheap AF or broke DO NOT go there or if you're just gonna complaint about the high prices!as for me I don't mind paying a lil more for my food if it's worth it!

Nakama is one of those places that pleases the masses. Go during happy hour, and you won't be able to hear the person next to you. The cocktail list is big and enticing, but the drinks aren't anything to write home about. Sushi is relatively good, albeit moderately overpriced. This is the type of place you go for the atmosphere, not the amazing food.

Industrial produced sushi with processed flavor, Nakama is great for people who do not like sushi as they heap mayonnaise and everything else on their fish to disguise its subpar quality. It's popular with drunk people who can't taste their food anyways.

Not highly suggested. Solid restaurant, cool atmosphere, and above average food. The lighting is insanely dark (at later hours); which makes reading hard and eye contact impossible. I have one absolute complaint: the splitting meal charge. If you and a friend split a meal, they charge $10. I think that it is all together an unnecessary charge; and even if the charge is somewhat of a requirement, ten dollars is too much. There ain't nothing wrong with some ladies wanting to split a hibachi meal.  BUT EDDY IS THE REAL OG. He works hibachi and he's an angel. That's all.

If you're into the whole hibachi thing and the whole doing copious amounts of sake bombs thing, Nakama can definitely be fun. But I feel like I'm kind of burned out on hibachi since you're basically paying out the ass for "the experience." I have been to a couple birthday parties here and had a good time, though.  As far as the sushi bar goes, this is one of the better sushi places in Pittsburgh. The fish is pretty fresh. But I feel like it's way overpriced if you just want to come here for sushi rather than hibachi. Nakama is in no way trying to be authentic--they have a large list of special rolls and most of them contain cream cheese or crabstick (two things I dislike, which limits my options here). My favorite thing I've had here is the salmon sashimi with avocado, cucumber, wasabi tobiko, and ponzu sauce, which I tried on a recent lunch visit.  Unfortunately, once night falls the atmosphere straight-up sucks. This is the hot spot for guidos to pregame before they head to Diesel or wherever else those people hang out. The drinks are what you would expect--boring, but fruity and easy to drink. Like I said, you can have an amazing time here if you bring your whole crew and are looking to get tipsy. But if you're not in the mood for a trashy night out, stay far away!

Nakama is an anomaly. In the heart of Pittsburgh's South Side you will find one of the best sushi restaurants in the US. The place is big, noisy, and a pick up scene at the bar in the evenings, but the fresh sushi and rolls are simply out of this world.   After several visits I was still baffled by how a Japanese restaurant in Pittsburgh could produce the best damn sushi and rolls I'd ever had. I spoke to the Sushi Chef and he explained everything is flown in fresh daily. Then we had colleagues from San Francisco come to town and they were blown away by Nakama's. Finally we had Japanese customers in town for a week so we awkwardly asked them out to eat "sushi in Pittsburgh!". After the meal they said it was the best they had experienced in the US.   I can't wait to get back there soon later this year. Sometimes the ideal visit is a Sunday afternoon sitting at the bar to catch a game and enjoy the great food with a Sapporo. Either way, make this a pit stop when you are in town - you'll be blown away.

We enjoyed the South side location, and were delighted to have Nakama in Wexford. We went with another couple, and sat at a table for 4 (not hibachi). First,  very surprised with the prices, but we ordered dinners. The food was cold; timing of the food brought to the table was poor, but Our waitress was very good. My meal was returned to the kitchen, and the other 3 people were finished before my meal was re-delivered, and it was cold. For the pricing and quality of food does not justify the cost for the meal. I hope things will change for the better, we would enjoy returning. Thank You
Few issues I've had here, typically get take out.  No plastic utensil,  got soup??? To bad.  Also they'll say 15 min and I'll get there in 15 to wait another 20 min.  Dissapointed

Great atmosphere and great sushi! I wanted to take my friend from out of town down south side and be on the classier side of things. We strolled around and decided on nakama. We love sushi and wanted a good cocktail! How could we go wrong here? We sat at the sushi bar and were waited on quickly. Our waitress was great and attentive but not annoying. She was considerate and asked us if we wanted separate checks which I always forget to ask upfront. My friend got the nakama Cosmo which she thought had too much sour mix. I had the French kiss, it was great. Sweet and sour but not overly sweet. We then split three sushi rolls and seaweed salad. Love seaweed salad. Sweet and vinegary with a good crunch. We got the basic salmon roll, Hawaiian roll and haiku roll. They were so delicious and very fresh. Came quickly too on a very busy Saturday night. Great place to get hibachi with a group of friends or intimate for a date! Not the cheapest option for good sushi is south side but the atmosphere makes it very worthwhile!

I got the chicken hibachi and the mango tango roll. The roll was really delicious. Fresh and flavorful. The hibachi, though was pretty bad. The chicken was diced super tiny and extremely overcooked which gave it a chewy texture and there was an odd chemical taste to everything. It does come with salad and soup so I was still full despite not eating much of the hibachi.

Went here Monday afternoon.  Not busy at all, but the server was too busy talking to her friend.   Had their sushi (Maki Nigiri), the three fishes were five stars (Tuna, salmon, yellowtail).  The spicy tuna roll was ok.  Too bad they dont have other sushi sets.  They have 2pcs per order, but sets would be nice.  Had a side order ebi (shrimp), asked the server if it was raw shrimp or cooked.  She said raw, but she was wrong.  High hope cause it was $6.99.  But no, it's not worth it.  Might try again for their Hibachi menu.  Ok with rolls... but if I really want sushi in pieces, I will go elsewhere.   Always wanted to go to Nakama but dont want to go to south side, this first experience with Nakama north was somewhat a disappointment.

Hibachi is mediocre but the sushi is outstanding! All of their rolls are delicious, unique, and fresh. My favorite is the Nakama Maki. Hibachi is nothing special and there was a long wait for just mediocre food.
Excellent Hibachi! Food Was Amazing! Fresh Fresh Fresh! Portion size was Big! Will Deff put this one on the top of my List! Very Delicious and satisfy at the right Price!

Nakama has become one of our date spots. We always sit at the bar. Great beer selection and bar tenders will give recommendations. We order 3-4 rolls and leave absolutely stuffed. Favorites include the red dragon, dragon, and rainbow roll. It isn't mind blowing sushi by any means, but for a delicious almost junk food sushi experience I can recommend it.

Good food but you are paying for the atmosphere. Can't order sushi for take out past 5pm or somewhere around that time. Gets easily crowded and so loud you can't hear your friends talking. I go to the sushi place in the waterfront. Better prices and less crowded and free parking.

I find the sushi rolls to be quite good contrary to several reviewers here, though I usually put most of my efforts toward hibachi.  My favorite hibachi meal is the kobe beef.  It's pricey, but the taste is a significant experience for me because I love steak.  Note, I am getting rolls and not nigiri or sashimi (go to Umi for that!).    I have been disappointed often times with the "performance" of the chef.  From an entertainment perspective, I've seen better, but the most important aspect is the food and I've always had it well prepared.    The drinks are well mixed in my experience.  I even ordered the one with the glowing ice cube once, which was great, if only for the ice cube and ensuing ridicule.  They offer a limited wine selection, but there are 1 or 2 decent options by the glass.  The place is definitely packed all the time, which either makes for good people watching or is sure to annoy you -- it depends what kind of person you are.  I happen to enjoy the crowd.  The bathroom attendant is a bit much though.  Yeah, it's pricey, but you get a lot of food.  Most times everyone I'm with ends up taking some for the road.

I'm really at a loss for what to say. Nakama has long been one of my favorite restaurants. This has been a favorite destination for birthdays and other special occasions. I went here for lunch on my wedding day! So when I moved recently, it's been a quest to get back there again. And then today happened...      I went today, expecting a pleasant and entertaining experience. Unfortunately, I didn't get what I was expecting. I went there, expecting the full knife-tossing, food-flaming experience. Instead, I got a cook who cooked out food with his head down, barely daring to even speak with us. Half of the table's food was finished cooking before he even started the other half, leaving my friends to make the decision to eat before us or wait till their food was cold. I kept waiting for him to set our meal aflame. It's my absolute favorite thing about hibachi restaurants. But it never happened. He finished cooking in silence, cleaned the cooktop, and left.      Now, I don't want to be entirely negative. The food WAS as delicious as I expected. Out waitress was very friendly and attentive. When one friend ordered the Nakama Panda (drink) and they were out of panda mugs, she provided us with a Lucky Cat mug instead.      This experience has left a bad taste in my mouth, but I sincerely hope and expect it to be better next time I go back. And I will. One less-than-expected trip will not spoil this fantastic restaurant for me!

If you are looking for the twenty something see be seen crowd, this is where they mingle. My group considers this place a birthday celebratory location. Special occasion= a fire show...indeed! They have sushi and the quintessential hibachi grill chefs performing wild antics as they prepare your dinner. These guys know what they're doing and they are some of the best around. Shrimp slinging into my mouth...GOAL!  The specialty cocktails are ginormous with all the fixings, pineapple, cherries, and Hawaiian umbrellas galore. Nakama Panda anyone?  I get drunk just looking at them, yes they are too sweet and I feel like I have been transported to the magical world of the smurfs as I sip the comical bright blue drink!   Picture a night out with your friends, eight to ten of you surrounding a steel table with a wooden ledge to perch at as you are served a Nakama salad with ginger dressing and greens. The dressings are always so tart. Next a small bowl of Nakama onion soup with mushrooms. I like the Hibachi shrimp fried rice with the sauces to dip my "shkrimps."  The food is common for this type of place so nothing exceptional. Entrees start at around $20. At least one person in the party has to get hibachi or no fireworks! As the meal is cooking blasts of fire warm your face as you munch and drink up the starters. At some point food will be thrown at your face!   Finally the Pi√®ce de r√©sistance, happy birthday singers with your Birthday sunday complete with sprinklers and fan fare. (Note that you have to purchase this in advance or you just get a boring scoop of ice cream) enter giant gong..."GONG!!"  You're done! Out to the southside street you go to get LOUD and continue the party!
I wanted some good sushi on a Friday night, and didn't get it. Hibachi was good. And the ceramic cup was exciting

I am a little sad to have had this experience with Nakama in the last times I've been here because it used to be my favorite sushi place in Pittsburgh. My last time here was yesterday,  the worst experience ever. I went there with a friend and we sat down in the high tables area, and the table was super dirty and STICKY! #Ew we informed the waitress about the situation and she cleaned it. The quality of the food that night was bad also, we had the steak hibachi and it arrived cold and tasted like it was there since yesterday. The food quality was really bad in the last times I've been here and I wanted to give Nakama one last shot. After this time, NEVER TO COME BACK AGAIN.  The service was never that great and now the food quality has gotten just as bad + coming to a dirty table = really disappointed

I can't actually comment on the food.  The place looked nice relative to a lot of neighboring establishments and was recommended by our lunch-time server @ Nola (very good Creole) and our concierge.  My low rating comes from the fact that I called twice to make a reservation and no one answered.  After taking a cab from downtown we learned there was a private party and we wouldn't be able to take in the Jersey Shore fist pumping scene (thanks Callan W for the visual).  Simply disappointed in the lack of basic customer service.  We ended up down the street at the Pittsburgh Steak Company.  Not sushi but the gorgonzola filet melts in your mouth!!

It's interesting that one of the most crowded restaurants in the South Side (possibly, all of Pittsburgh?) has such bad ratings on Yelp. I think Yelpers have it right in the case. Nakama totally did not live up to the hype for me. I had the hibachi and it was just mediocre. The chef / entertainer wasn't even that good - no cool tricks and he didn't even try throwing food in my mouth. The place was so loud that there is no way you can have a decent conversation if you come with a group of people. And, I swear they celebrated 10 birthdays during the hour we were dining there. They have this irritating gong that they bring out. You can't hear the guy next to you, but you will hear every birthday dinner that night.   A bunch of my co-workers like Nakama's sushi bar, so when I get a chance to try it, I'll update my review. Until then, I'm not quickly planning my next Nakama outing.

Went here with my son and decided to sit bar side! My son ordered shrimp hibachi I ordered chicken fried rice. My son got his food and finished and and I still had not gotten my rice! When I mentioned it to the waiter she said it'll be right out! 5min passed and she walks back by and says your rice will be right out! When I finally got my rice it was Nasty burnt sticky unflavored! Not one time did the waitress apologize for any mix up!!!! Never again and I visit this place every time I come to Pittsburgh drone Orlando Florida!!!

My sister & I went to the sushi bar on a Sunday afternoon and I was quite pleased. The chefs at the bar were very friendly and chatty (though I'm sure that had something to do with how empty the place was), and we got a ton of sushi for under $40. My sister got the spider rolls and I ended up stealing a few because they were so tasty. I live in Chicago, and the prices were pretty comparable to cheaper sushi there, so it was a great deal. My sister keeps saying we have to go back over the holidays, and I definitely agree!  EDIT: So we went back on Saturday and this time shared the maki platter, some Spider rolls, and the Hanalei rolls.  The hanalei rolls were by far the best sushi I have ever had. I am still having dreams about them.  That's all.
Always busy. Good sushi...a little on the pricey end but its always a popular place to go.

The hibachis were already closed, but that is fine since I save my teppanyaki experiences for Benihana.  We sat at the drink bar and looked through the menu to find items that we might want.  It doesn't take me long to find what I want in an Asian restaurant:  Gyoza Spider roll Spicy tuna roll Spicy chicken pieces Hibachi fried rice Marinated beef tips  Everything arrived in increments, which was great since it was so much food.  Our drinks were always full and the service was spectacular.  Where did Nakama go wrong?  All of the food tasted like a shadow of what it could have been. The flavors were not vibrant, which really was sad since I could tell that the ingredients were fresh.  My sushi didn't smell and it didn't have a fishy taste; it just had very little taste altogether.    Nothing was spicy -- piquant -- that was supposed to be spicy.  The spicy chicken pieces are more sweet than anything else and the beef and rice was just as flavorless.  I wish that there was more flavor to everything that I ate; especially considering the price tag.
Pretty disappointing experience. Terrible service, mediocre food and unhospitable management. Will not return and would not recommend

The only thing good about this place is the people watching from a table by the window. The drinks are watered down and over priced. The sushi is lack luster. And the hibachi will more than likely ruin your night because you'll spend all night with epic diarrhea.

This was my second experience there. That being said it was sub par in the service end of the establishment. Food... AMAZING..!!! "Show"... Eh... Hostess was completely and utterly rude to us and her co-workers.   The habachi segment left us wanting more of a show... Tables around us were laughing and having fun and our guy did nothing more than cook and cut vegetables..... Our server was decent. Young kid and full of energy and pretty attentive!   Great place to come but they need to retrain or get rid of the dead weight in the hostess stand and hype up the particular chef we had.

Even though we had reservations this was probably the worst service I ever had. The food was good and the chef did a very nice job but they are overpriced and up-charge for things like fried rice. The waiter constantly forgot items and messed up the to go order. Saga and Ichiban are a much better and cheaper options.

I really wish this place was great, but unfortunately, the decor does not make up for the mediocre sushi and the abhorrent clientele.  That place during happy hour reminds me of a Bosch painting, except for populated by yuppies instead of the naked damned.  The waitstaff is decent, but the hibachi chefs are kind of weak.  If you go on the weekend, you can have an awkward conversation about how loud you pee with the bathroom attendant.  I guess there's not a lot of small talk to be had.  I have had fun in this place, but I can have fun pretty much anywhere.  Oh, and if it is crowded, good luck hearing a word that anybody says.
Great for a birthday celebration. Great server and excellent cook! Had so much fun  and food was amazing. Had the veggie option and everything was cooked to perfection.

You would think by the crowds in this place it was the only sushi place in the whole city of Pittsburgh. I went in with good expectations of this place considering it is always crowded.....boy was I wrong!!!  First off the service at this place is horrible. This is mostly a 22-28 yr old staffed place. The hostess basically laughed at me when I said we did not have a reservation, offered us to have a drink at the bar, and then said "but you cannot stand around in this area here around the door it is getting too crowded so either the bar or maybe wait outside" ...seriously you don't tell a customer that.   We just wanted sushi anyways, so we sat at the sushi bar and ordered some rolls and sashimi. Now maybe I am spoiled from living on the west coast for so long now that I am used to Asians (usually Japanese..go figure) working and making my sushi. There were 3 white guys about 25 yrs old making my rolls for me, not to say they cannot do it as well as anyone else, but the rolls were seriously not that great.  Hell I did not even see an Asian person working at the tables either, they were mostly Mexican guys.   Sorry, I know most of the reviews are raving about how good this place is, but to me it seems pretty pricey for what you get and the food is not all that. I can only speak for the sushi...maybe the dinners at the tables are better. To sum it up this is mostly an over priced sushi bar that is a good place to hang out and have drinks with friends and maybe hit on some groups of women out for dinner.

Okay, let me preface all of this by saying they'd get 5 stars if they weren't BLASTING 90's hip hop over the speakers. I get it, it's the south side. But on the same hand, it's a restaurant. Slow your roll. (See what i did there?)  I've had nakama bookmarked on Yelp for close to four years. I've always wanted to go, but never really made the time. Got asked on a date here, and couldn't turn it down. I love sushi.  So, this cant speak to the hibachi tables, but maybe someday it can.   Arrived at 8pm on Saturday for our reservation, and immediately were seated at a (wobbly) table by the window. We knew we were there for sushi, and we couldn't wait to get to ordering. They have paper sushi menus you can fill out with a little golf pencil and turn in like homework to make your sushi appear. We just kept checking boxes. Haha! So many amazing choices. Thanks to everyone who recommended the Hanalei Roll, it was amazing!   So the order went a little something like this; Spider Roll, Hanalei Roll, Pittsburgh Penguins Roll (much to the disappointment of my date did not contain penguin. KIDDING), Spicy Crab Salad Roll, and the Crunchy Philly Roll. When Leah, our server, brought them out we (and our little wobbly table) were a little overwhelmed. But we made it disappear quite quickly.   Neither one of us really liked the Penguins Roll. Seemed like it was just..missing something. The spider roll is forever my go to when trying new sushi. It was great. The Hanalei Roll, as previously stated was incredible. Who knew you could flash fry sushi?! The crunchy Philly Roll was about the same. Really good and disappeared quickly. My amazing date really enjoyed the spicy crab salad roll. Leah recommended it, and it was an excellent choice.   Everything was really great. No complaints on service, Leah made sure we had everything we needed quickly, and kept our water glasses full. Let's turn that music down a little bit, remember, this is Nakama, not Jimmy D's.   I will definitely be back. Hopefully WE will definitely be back.   Happy Eating!
Best sushi north of Nakama in South Side. Notice a trend? Seriously great beer selection, very fresh sushi. Very good ginger dressing and miso soup was on point. I will certainly be back.

This visit was like the final straw of an ex boyfriend that I hadn't gotten over....except now I am!  Nakama just isn't the same restaurant I remember. Maybe it's been a few years since I've been to Nakama, but instead of being a sushi/hibachi hot spot it feels more like a bar in south side that just happens to have sushi.  The staff seemed disinterested and chided us for making a reservation. Apparently we only needed one if we were ordering hibachi (we weren't).  The sushi fit our craving, but it was just mediocre. The seaweed salad was unusually sweet and the sushi was at least room temperature. I usually enjoy sushi that is a little on the colder side.  All in all, I'm glad we went to check it out since my romanticized last visit, but am ready to move on!

I think that this was closer to a 3 start restaurant but given the amount my father spent I can't give it 3 stars.  I booked this place for 6 adults and 2 kids because I thought the kids would really enjoy the experience.  We were in town celebrating my 40th birthday.  It is extremely loud which I expected, but didnt help the experience.  While our chef was nice enough, he didnt provide the "show" that you are also paying for and I feel the kids didnt get the full experience.  The food was good...however 2 of us ordered our filet medium and it was way overcooked.    Overall, it was a decent meal but I dont think we would return.

Came here for the first and most definitely the last time the other day. Decided to come here after many coworkers had recommended the establishment, and was left highly disappointed. My friend and I sat down at the bar, and it took the bartender about ten minutes to come over. I ordered a beer and my friend wanted to taste it before ordering one herself. After dropping off my drink, the bartender walked away and didn't come back for another ten minutes to take my friends drink order. After dropping that one off, walked away for another twenty minutes before taking our food orders. When I ordered, I asked to modify my sushi order a little and her exact response was "whatever, you're eating it, not me", and when I ordered a dish, it was "oh that's my absolute favorite but we don't make it anymore". If it's on the menu, shouldn't it be available? I asked for the sushi first and said I would decide on a main course after that came out. The sushi came out, and the order was completely wrong. After it had been sitting there and I tried to flag her down, she came over (again, about 20 minutes later) and just threw it in the trash right in front of us. Rolled her eyes and told me that I should have "explained what I wanted". Having now spent an hour here, we had just wanted to pay for our beers and leave, no longer wanting food. When I spoke with the manager, all she said was "this is the first complaint I've ever gotten about her", and walked away. Wish I could give zero stars just based off of the terrible service.
